task_text:
Remote Full Stack Developer   
  
  Designs, develops, installs, tests and documents complex applications software, including server, client, and web components. Contributes to the design and delivery of technical architecture solution components. Provides work guidance to less experienced personnel. May provide technical consulting on complex projects  
 
   Essential Job Functions   
 
  Provides more complex design documents and translates into component-level designs to accelerate development. Assists in developing strategy, design and data gathering approaches. Provides high level design expertise in support of development team efforts to provide flexible reusable components to increase cost effectiveness. Analyzes, designs and reviews design of applications and suites of applications to ensure that customer specifications are satisfied. Assists in overseeing relationships between application architects and development teams to ensure that product development and implementation are coordinated. Works with product development teams and senior designers in developing design requirements that are accurate and relevant to company needs. Recommends alternative courses of action as appropriate to meet requirement needs. Reviews and analyzes gathered information in technical research; evaluates tools and methodologies to ensure that designs adhere to current industry, client and company standards. Develops and provides technical documentation, participates and oversees test-plan development, integration and deployment. Assists in overseeing business process work sessions, project meetings and joint applications development sessions to ensure that product design decisions are communicated to departmental personnel. Functions as a domain expert and works closely with software developers to explain the application design, and coordinates activities between the two functions to enhance product quality and efficiency. Participates in cost analysis studies to determine feasibility of approaches. Utilizes experience in development methodologies, coding documentation, testing methodology and industry standards to define and develop project requirements, functional specifications and detailed design of application solutions for clients. Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel. Guides the work of less experienced developers to create, maintain and communicate details of application designs to ensure that designs are according to specifications. May provides technical consulting on complex projects. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time and form of desired results.  
  
   Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled   
Basic QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experienceBachelor's degree in software engineering, computer science, or related field preferred.Five or more years of experience in C#, ASP.net development.Experience with Oracle and SQL server databases.Experience of web service development.Experience with workflow management tools.Experience in debugging issues related to Windows server and IIS.Good experience of SDLC.Experience with MVC and Entity maintenance framework.Good knowledge of OOP concepts.Experience with Java a plus.Experience with Mongo a plus.Front-end skillsC#, ASP.NET MVC, Web APIJavaScript, jQuery, AJAXHTML5, CSS3, Responsive DesignUnderstanding of web technology stack, including HTTP, REST, cookies, caching, and asset loadingBack-end skillsWindows & web services, WCF, MSMQC# and .NET FrameworkProficient MS-SQL, Indexes, T-SQL, Stored Procedures, etc. Remote Full Stack Developer

task_text:
Capgemini Government Solutions (CGS) LLC is seeking highly motivated Salesforce Business Analyst to join our team to support our government clients. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing client requirements and development support via direct client interaction across a broad range of Salesforce applications.
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to apply and grow their skillset with a motivated and entrepreneurial team, engage with a wide range of stakeholders, and build CGS' capabilities serving our clients.
Job Responsibilities
As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will:
Support the current team in building a cohesive, streamlined and quality solution.
Capture, evaluate and groom business requirements to create clear business process and workflow, create clear user stories and solution deliverables with the required information to identify the best solution to implement the requirement(s).
Provide quality user experience with professional demeanor and excellent communication skills.
Gather, synthesize and define business requirements and convert requirements to code.
Work collaboratively in an agile environment to design solutions for government clients, including collaboration with developers.
Required Qualifications
U.S. Citizenship is required.
Eligible to obtain and maintain Government Security Clearance.
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related field.
1+years of experience in a related field as a business analyst or any IT-related experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (including presentation development)
Excellent problem-solving and collaborative skills.
Must be able to handle multiple tasks in a team based environment.
Strong communication and team building skills.
Nice to have skills/qualifications
Experience working in a team-based delivery environment, preferable in agile scrum teams.
Experience working with sandbox and production environments.
Experience collaborating with business stakeholders.
Experienceworking on Salesforce implementation through the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) using Agile.
Demonstrate adherence to all the Salesforce.com best practices.
Company Overview
A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of client's opportunities in the evolving world of cloud and digital platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of 200,000 team members in over 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion. Capgemini Government Solutions, LLC (Capgemini GS) is a subsidiary of Capgemini focused on providing high quality services to the U.S. Federal Government. Learn more about us at[Link available when viewing the job].
Capgemini has an entrepreneurial environment that embodies the following values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, and Fun. We offer a competitive benefits package to our employees.
Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with DisabilitiesThe contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c) Capgemini Government Solutions (CGS) LLC is seeking highly motivated Salesforce Business Analyst to join our team to support our government clients. Experience collaborating with business stakeholders.

Demonstrate adherence to all the Salesforce.com best practices.
A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of client's opportunities in the evolving world of cloud and digital platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of 200,000 team members in over 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion. Capgemini Government Solutions, LLC (Capgemini GS) is a subsidiary of Capgemini focused on providing high quality services to the U.S. Federal Government. Learn more about us at[Link available when viewing the job].
Capgemini has an entrepreneurial environment that embodies the following values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, and Fun. We offer a competitive benefits package to our employees.
Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

task_text:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Houston, TX that is seeking a Google Cloud API Devleoper. Summary: In this role, the Google Cloud API Devleoper will be primarily responsible for design and development of applications in Oracle Fusion platform specifically Google Cloud API integration using Java. This role performs planning, development, coding, testing, migration to production. The Google Cloud API Devleoper also adheres to applications standards and best practices.
REQUIREMENTS:
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline preferred  5+ years of demonstrated experience of Java language and 2+ years of experience of Google Cloud API integration using Java  Familiar on JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) data-interchange format  Knowledge on Java Application servers like Oracle WebLogic, Apache or IBM WebSphere and Internet technologies like HTML, XML, WSDL, scripting languages  Knowledge of SDLC activities on development projects  Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills  Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products  Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a timely manner  Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment 
 Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. task_title: Digital Strategist/Digital Art Director, Enterprise Creative Solutions (ECS)
task_text:
Job Description:
As a Digital Art Director in Enterprise Creative Solutions (ECS) you will work in a team environment to create visual experiences that delight clients while achieving business goals. You will be responsible for driving strategy for interactive projects from concept through execution across all digital platforms with a primary focus on, websites, video, online advertising and social media.
Your goal will be to deliver solid digital solutions for products and services across many lines of business in the banking industry and over time you will understand the products and services as a subject matter expert. You respect brand positioning and can determine when it is appropriate to push the limits to improve the customer experience. You love what you do and enjoy being in a team environment.
As an ideal candidate for this position, you should be innovative, and web and multimedia savvy. Ultimately, as the Digital Strategist/Digital Art Director, you should have a firm grasp of the various digital touchpoints, steer our organization's digital narrative, and drive highly effective digital campaigns.
This role gives you the opportunity to:
Evaluate and implement improvements on digital strategy
Research the latest digital tools and interactive trends
Create integrated and cost-effective digital strategies
Analyze and report on digital campaigns
Analyze customer and user data
Inform the team on technology trends and best practices
Build strong collaborative relationships with a diverse agency team as well as segment, channel and brand partners
Push your craft, continuously improve your skillset, and lead innovation and fresh approaches in concepting through design execution
Share your ideas and demonstrate clear thinking
Communicate what the client experience will be, direct information architecture, workflows and interdependencies through schematics and design development
Actively participate in design meetings and critiques, ensuring adherence to standards while keeping an eye out for improvements or reasonable exceptions
Embrace working in an office while collaborating with teammates and partners in other locations
Interpret and implement the brand expression and create solutions that elevate the brand experience 
Understand target audience’s needs and behaviors while incorporating best practices and channel knowledge to promote advanced solutions for the user experience that will drive results
Field technical client questions and follow up with client education on existing and new digital technologies
Conceptualize and collaborate with creative team to create fully integrated human experiences and develop digital communications; user-friendly accessible websites and media including websites, microsites, email, banners and social touch points
ECS is Bank of America’s award-winning in-house agency that delivers strategic creative solutions, content, and digital asset/media management at a cost competitive advantage. At ECS we:
Deliver strategic, on-brand solutions for integrated, large scale projects, and fast turn on the less complicated ones
Lead a digital management Center of Excellence to protect the use and the distribution of bank electronic media including content that is stored, transferred and pushed digitally
Are aligned with bank marketing technology strategies to deliver speed and customization
At Bank of America you will find a welcoming and supportive workplace.  The key tenant of our Bank is to help make financial live better through the power of every connection, and our values focus on delivering together, acting responsibly, trusting our teams, and realizing the power of our people – all ideas which promote teamwork, inclusivity, diversity, and opportunity for personal achievement among our employees. At Bank of America we:
Support our communities through giving and volunteering
Assist our employees with products and services to support their financial needs 
Look to achieve efficiency and simplicity in our business models
Continuously advance our tools and technology to meet evolving employee and client needs
Required Skills/Traits
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and experience
10+ years of experience as a digital or interactive designer with a concentration on digital strategy
Thorough understanding of digital touchpoints
Understanding of web analytics
Possess broad knowledge of digital practices
Self-starting, proactive, collaborative, seeker of opportunities in the work
An organized, buttoned-up, professional approach to executing work
Excellent verbal and written communication
A collaborative team player
Passion for technology, industry awareness, and ongoing evolution
Solid knowledge of social media platforms and design standards
Have an understanding and proficiency in accessibility design and standards for the web such as WCAG 2.1 (Wen Content Accessibility Guidelines), Web Content, Users Agents Authoring Tools, Operable UI, Nav, ect.
Pluses
Show the flexibility to fulfill design, coach and steer creative execution, and testing roles
Prior experience working with or for financial institutions
Working understanding of HTML, CSS, web standards and their impacts on creative and design with a strong understanding of the differences between email and web capabilities
An enthusiastic approach with an infectiously positive point of view, and are a highly motivated self-starter with a strong work ethic
Advanced understanding of Mobile-First creative and design development
Show the flexibility to fulfill design, execution and testing roles
Agile methodology
Scrum certification
Software
Work on Mac (primarily) and Windows PC for testing.
Proficiency in After Effects, Premiere, Animate, Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, and Sketch
Experience in Cinema 4D a plus
Job Band:
H4
Shift: 
1st shift (United States of America)
Hours Per Week:
40
Weekly Schedule:
Referral Bonus Amount:
0
 -->

Job Description:
As a Digital Art Director in Enterprise Creative Solutions (ECS) you will work in a team environment to create visual experiences that delight clients while achieving business goals. You will be responsible for driving strategy for interactive projects from concept through execution across all digital platforms with a primary focus on, websites, video, online advertising and social media.
Your goal will be to deliver solid digital solutions for products and services across many lines of business in the banking industry and over time you will understand the products and services as a subject matter expert. You respect brand positioning and can determine when it is appropriate to push the limits to improve the customer experience. You love what you do and enjoy being in a team environment.
As an ideal candidate for this position, you should be innovative, and web and multimedia savvy. Ultimately, as the Digital Strategist/Digital Art Director, you should have a firm grasp of the various digital touchpoints, steer our organization's digital narrative, and drive highly effective digital campaigns.
This role gives you the opportunity to:
Evaluate and implement improvements on digital strategy
Research the latest digital tools and interactive trends
Create integrated and cost-effective digital strategies
Analyze and report on digital campaigns
Analyze customer and user data
Inform the team on technology trends and best practices
Build strong collaborative relationships with a diverse agency team as well as segment, channel and brand partners
Push your craft, continuously improve your skillset, and lead innovation and fresh approaches in concepting through design execution
Share your ideas and demonstrate clear thinking
Communicate what the client experience will be, direct information architecture, workflows and interdependencies through schematics and design development
Actively participate in design meetings and critiques, ensuring adherence to standards while keeping an eye out for improvements or reasonable exceptions
Embrace working in an office while collaborating with teammates and partners in other locations
Interpret and implement the brand expression and create solutions that elevate the brand experience 
Understand target audience’s needs and behaviors while incorporating best practices and channel knowledge to promote advanced solutions for the user experience that will drive results
Field technical client questions and follow up with client education on existing and new digital technologies
Conceptualize and collaborate with creative team to create fully integrated human experiences and develop digital communications; user-friendly accessible websites and media including websites, microsites, email, banners and social touch points
ECS is Bank of America’s award-winning in-house agency that delivers strategic creative solutions, content, and digital asset/media management at a cost competitive advantage. At ECS we:
Deliver strategic, on-brand solutions for integrated, large scale projects, and fast turn on the less complicated ones
Lead a digital management Center of Excellence to protect the use and the distribution of bank electronic media including content that is stored, transferred and pushed digitally
Are aligned with bank marketing technology strategies to deliver speed and customization
At Bank of America you will find a welcoming and supportive workplace.  The key tenant of our Bank is to help make financial live better through the power of every connection, and our values focus on delivering together, acting responsibly, trusting our teams, and realizing the power of our people – all ideas which promote teamwork, inclusivity, diversity, and opportunity for personal achievement among our employees. At Bank of America we:
Support our communities through giving and volunteering
Assist our employees with products and services to support their financial needs 
Look to achieve efficiency and simplicity in our business models
Continuously advance our tools and technology to meet evolving employee and client needs
Required Skills/Traits
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and experience
10+ years of experience as a digital or interactive designer with a concentration on digital strategy
Thorough understanding of digital touchpoints
Understanding of web analytics
Possess broad knowledge of digital practices
Self-starting, proactive, collaborative, seeker of opportunities in the work
An organized, buttoned-up, professional approach to executing work
Excellent verbal and written communication
A collaborative team player
Passion for technology, industry awareness, and ongoing evolution
Solid knowledge of social media platforms and design standards
Have an understanding and proficiency in accessibility design and standards for the web such as WCAG 2.1 (Wen Content Accessibility Guidelines), Web Content, Users Agents Authoring Tools, Operable UI, Nav, ect.
Pluses
Show the flexibility to fulfill design, coach and steer creative execution, and testing roles
Prior experience working with or for financial institutions
Working understanding of HTML, CSS, web standards and their impacts on creative and design with a strong understanding of the differences between email and web capabilities
An enthusiastic approach with an infectiously positive point of view, and are a highly motivated self-starter with a strong work ethic
Advanced understanding of Mobile-First creative and design development
Show the flexibility to fulfill design, execution and testing roles
Agile methodology
Scrum certification
Software
Work on Mac (primarily) and Windows PC for testing.
Proficiency in After Effects, Premiere, Animate, Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, and Sketch
Experience in Cinema 4D a plus

task_experience:
As a Digital Art Director in Enterprise Creative Solutions (ECS) you will work in a team environment to create visual experiences that delight clients while achieving business goals. You will be responsible for driving strategy for interactive projects from concept through execution across all digital platforms with a primary focus on, websites, video, online advertising and social media.
Your goal will be to deliver solid digital solutions for products and services across many lines of business in the banking industry and over time you will understand the products and services as a subject matter expert. You respect brand positioning and can determine when it is appropriate to push the limits to improve the customer experience. You love what you do and enjoy being in a team environment.
As an ideal candidate for this position, you should be innovative, and web and multimedia savvy. Ultimately, as the Digital Strategist/Digital Art Director, you should have a firm grasp of the various digital touchpoints, steer our organization's digital narrative, and drive highly effective digital campaigns.
This role gives you the opportunity to:
Evaluate and implement improvements on digital strategy
Research the latest digital tools and interactive trends
Analyze and report on digital campaigns
Analyze customer and user data
Inform the team on technology trends and best practices
Build strong collaborative relationships with a diverse agency team as well as segment, channel and brand partners
Push your craft, continuously improve your skillset, and lead innovation and fresh approaches in concepting through design execution
Communicate what the client experience will be, direct information architecture, workflows and interdependencies through schematics and design development
Actively participate in design meetings and critiques, ensuring adherence to standards while keeping an eye out for improvements or reasonable exceptions
Embrace working in an office while collaborating with teammates and partners in other locations
Interpret and implement the brand expression and create solutions that elevate the brand experience 
Understand target audience’s needs and behaviors while incorporating best practices and channel knowledge to promote advanced solutions for the user experience that will drive results
Field technical client questions and follow up with client education on existing and new digital technologies
Conceptualize and collaborate with creative team to create fully integrated human experiences and develop digital communications; user-friendly accessible websites and media including websites, microsites, email, banners and social touch points
ECS is Bank of America’s award-winning in-house agency that delivers strategic creative solutions, content, and digital asset/media management at a cost competitive advantage. At ECS we:
Deliver strategic, on-brand solutions for integrated, large scale projects, and fast turn on the less complicated ones
Lead a digital management Center of Excellence to protect the use and the distribution of bank electronic media including content that is stored, transferred and pushed digitally
Are aligned with bank marketing technology strategies to deliver speed and customization
At Bank of America you will find a welcoming and supportive workplace.  The key tenant of our Bank is to help make financial live better through the power of every connection, and our values focus on delivering together, acting responsibly, trusting our teams, and realizing the power of our people – all ideas which promote teamwork, inclusivity, diversity, and opportunity for personal achievement among our employees. At Bank of America we:
Assist our employees with products and services to support their financial needs 
Look to achieve efficiency and simplicity in our business models
Continuously advance our tools and technology to meet evolving employee and client needs
Self-starting, proactive, collaborative, seeker of opportunities in the work
Passion for technology, industry awareness, and ongoing evolution
Have an understanding and proficiency in accessibility design and standards for the web such as WCAG 2.1 (Wen Content Accessibility Guidelines), Web Content, Users Agents Authoring Tools, Operable UI, Nav, ect.
Show the flexibility to fulfill design, coach and steer creative execution, and testing roles
Prior experience working with or for financial institutions
Show the flexibility to fulfill design, execution and testing roles
Work on Mac (primarily) and Windows PC for testing.
Job Band:
1st shift (United States of America)

task_title: Lead Software Engineer, Credit Card Platforms
task_text:
OneMain Financial holds a strong commitment to our customers, communities and team members.  This approach to lending has helped us provide customers with loan options for over 100 years and grow to over 1,600 branches in 44 states.  We know that success starts from within, which is why we place emphasis on creating a team of talented and dedicated individuals.  If you’re looking for a place to work collaboratively and build your career from the ground up, think OneMain.As part of a demonstrated commitment, we are investing in digital innovation, emerging products and new ways to help our customers with their financial wellbeing. This role is on our industry leading credit cards platform.We are looking for a Lead Backend Engineer to join our team.  You will work with our product, design and engineering teams to plan, design, and develop web and mobile applications for credit cards. We offer an opportunity to work in a collaborative and inclusive environment with people who value their work and who welcome fresh ideas.Who you are:
You’re driven to build intuitive experiences that start with the customer first
You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries and expand `your knowledge and skill set
What you'll do:
Perform complex application programming activities with an emphasis on mobile development:  Angular, Node, TypeScript, JavaScript, RESTful APIs and more
Lead the definition of system architecture and detailed solution design that are scalable and extensible
Collaborate with Product Owners, Designers, and other engineers on different permutations to find the best solution possible
Own the quality of code and do your own testing. Automate feature testing and contribute UI testing framework
Become a subject matter expert for our mobile applications backend and middleware
Deliver amazing solutions to production that knock everyone’s socks off
Mentor junior developers on the team
Provide assistance to technical team as needed
Assist in interviewing and building out technical team
Suggest improvements to optimize delivery
What we’re looking for:
Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.
A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.
A love for working in ambiguity—and making sense of it. You can take in a lot of disparate information and find common themes, recommend clear paths forward and iterate along the way. You don’t form an opinion and sell it as if it’s gospel; this is all about being flexible, agile, dependable, and responsive in the face of many moving parts.
Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.
Flexible and willing to accept change in priorities, as necessary
Demonstrable passion for technology (e.g., personal projects, open-source involvement) 
Enthusiastic embrace of DevOps culture and collaborative software engineering
Ability and desire to work in a dynamic, fast paced, and agile team environment
Enthusiasm for cloud computing platforms such as AWS or Azure
Basic Qualifications: 
Minimum B.S. / M.S. Computer Science or related discipline from accredited college or University
At least 10+ years of experience designing, developing, and delivering backend applications with Node.js, TypeScript, JavaScript, Restful APIs and related backend frameworks
At least 2 years of experience building internet facing applications
At least 2 years of experience with AWS and/or OpenShift
Proficient in following concepts: object-oriented programming, software engineering techniques, quality engineering, parallel programming, databases, etc. 
Proficient in building and consuming RESTful APIs
Proficient in managing multiple tasks and consistently meet established timelines 
Experience integrating APIs with front-end and/or mobile-specific frameworks 
Strong collaboration skills
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Financial Services experience and Credit Card experience a big plus.
Experience with Apache Cordova framework
Demonstrable knowledge of native coding background in iOS, Android
Experience developing and deploying applications within Kubernetes based containers
Experience in Agile and SCRUM development techniques
Note: Employment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity.Benefits:Because we want our team members to bring us their very best every day, we believe they deserve the right opportunities and benefits. That’s why we packed our comprehensive benefits package for full- and some part-timers with:
Health and wellbeing options for team members and their dependents
Up to 4% matching 401(k)
Tuition reimbursement
Continuing education
Bonus eligible
Paid time off
Paid volunteer time 
And more 
Our Company:OneMain Financial is the country’s largest lending-exclusive financial company, proudly serving millions of customers with safe, affordable and transparent installment loans. Our customers turn to us every day—online and at 1,500 branches in 44 states—to help them take control and improve their financial lives with solutions for debt consolidation, medical expenses, household bills, home improvements and auto purchases. Our talented and dedicated team members constantly look for responsible ways to serve our customers when, where and how they want. It’s all about doing the right thing—a mission that hasn’t changed for more than 100 years.#LI-EK1OneMain Holdings, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action (AA) employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. OneMain Financial holds a strong commitment to our customers, communities and team members.  This approach to lending has helped us provide customers with loan options for over 100 years and grow to over 1,600 branches in 44 states.  We know that success starts from within, which is why we place emphasis on creating a team of talented and dedicated individuals.  If you’re looking for a place to work collaboratively and build your career from the ground up, think OneMain.As part of a demonstrated commitment, we are investing in digital innovation, emerging products and new ways to help our customers with their financial wellbeing. This role is on our industry leading credit cards platform.We are looking for a Lead Backend Engineer to join our team.  You will work with our product, design and engineering teams to plan, design, and develop web and mobile applications for credit cards. We offer an opportunity to work in a collaborative and inclusive environment with people who value their work and who welcome fresh ideas.Who you are:
You’re driven to build intuitive experiences that start with the customer first
You embrace change and innovation, always seeking to push the boundaries and expand `your knowledge and skill set
What you'll do:
Perform complex application programming activities with an emphasis on mobile development:  Angular, Node, TypeScript, JavaScript, RESTful APIs and more
Lead the definition of system architecture and detailed solution design that are scalable and extensible
Collaborate with Product Owners, Designers, and other engineers on different permutations to find the best solution possible
Own the quality of code and do your own testing. Automate feature testing and contribute UI testing framework
Become a subject matter expert for our mobile applications backend and middleware
Deliver amazing solutions to production that knock everyone’s socks off
Mentor junior developers on the team
Provide assistance to technical team as needed
Assist in interviewing and building out technical team
Suggest improvements to optimize delivery
Amazing technical instincts. You know how to evaluate and choose the right technology and approach for the job. You have stories you could share about what problem you thought you were solving at first, but through testing and iteration, came to solve a much bigger and better problem that resulted in positive outcomes all-around.
A love for learning. Technology is continually evolving around us, and you want to keep up to date to ensure we are using the right tech at the right time.
A love for working in ambiguity—and making sense of it. You can take in a lot of disparate information and find common themes, recommend clear paths forward and iterate along the way. You don’t form an opinion and sell it as if it’s gospel; this is all about being flexible, agile, dependable, and responsive in the face of many moving parts.
Confidence, not ego. You have an ability to collaborate with others and see all sides of the coin to come to the best solution for everyone.
Flexible and willing to accept change in priorities, as necessary
Enthusiastic embrace of DevOps culture and collaborative software engineering
Ability and desire to work in a dynamic, fast paced, and agile team environment
Experience integrating APIs with front-end and/or mobile-specific frameworks 
Experience developing and deploying applications within Kubernetes based containers
Note: Employment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity.Benefits:Because we want our team members to bring us their very best every day, we believe they deserve the right opportunities and benefits. That’s why we packed our comprehensive benefits package for full- and some part-timers with:
And more 
Our Company:OneMain Financial is the country’s largest lending-exclusive financial company, proudly serving millions of customers with safe, affordable and transparent installment loans. Our customers turn to us every day—online and at 1,500 branches in 44 states—to help them take control and improve their financial lives with solutions for debt consolidation, medical expenses, household bills, home improvements and auto purchases. Our talented and dedicated team members constantly look for responsible ways to serve our customers when, where and how they want. It’s all about doing the right thing—a mission that hasn’t changed for more than 100 years.#LI-EK1OneMain Holdings, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action (AA) employer. task_title: Credit Risk Analytics Assoc. - Consumer Data Reporting
task_text:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message.  In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application. 
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
As the company's second line of defense, Corporate Risk — or Independent Risk Management — provides independent oversight of risk-taking activities. Independent Risk Management establishes and maintains Wells Fargo's risk management program and provides oversight, including challenges to and independent assessment of, the frontline's execution of its risk management responsibilities. We manage risk according to the Risk Management Framework and ensure all employees understand their individual accountability for managing risk. Corporate Risk roles depend on a variety of skills, including: Data analysis and synthesis, root cause analysis, change management, process management & execution, risk governance, risk strategy, risk identification & assessment, risk prevention, controls & mitigation, risk monitoring, reporting & escalation, risk systems & technology.
The Credit Risk team is responsible for data aggregation, analysis and interpretation, and providing data to others for monitoring and oversight of the credit portfolio and delivering insights and decision strategies. Performs various moderately complex activities related to business analysis and/or modeling. May perform complex analysis and/or modeling that assesses the market, credit and/or operational risk of new and existing products, maximizes profits and/or asset growth and minimizes credit and/or operating losses and other risk exposures. Provides analytical support on wholesale and/or retail credit, operating losses and other product strategies to ensure company goals are met. Segments and monitors various credit, deposit and other product groups, vintages, concentration limits, risk ratings, etc. and making recommendations to management based on those trends. Produce performance monitoring and benchmarks regarding growth, mix, delinquency, losses grade migration, and overall profitability and performance. Coordinates and consolidates the production of monthly, quarterly, and annual performance reports for senior management; reviewing and analyzing trends in current population distributions and recommending strategies. May develop more complex programming models to extract data and/or manipulate databases to provide statistical and financial modeling. May manage the roll-out of pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models for supported business or product line. May be responsible for process production, data reconciliation and model documentation in alignment with policy governance. May manage large scale cross functional/cross business unit projects and regulatory requests.
Within Corporate Risk, the Credit Consulting and Services Team is a group is seeking two Credit Risk Analytics Associates with a strong technical and data analysis skill sets. Focus of roles Credit Card portfolio and Small Business Lending. In addition to the various teams within CC&S, this position will have exposure to multiple groups across the enterprise including Finance, Consumer Credit, and Internal Audit. Team members will help ensure that key consumer data are delivered accurately within monthly time-frames, utilizing SAS/SQL code. The primary responsibilities for this role are to maintain/modify code, assemble, validate and deliver monthly data, which is used for internal and external reporting. 
Roles and Responsibilities include, but not limited to, the following:
 Partner with Risk, Technology, Finance, and Operations teams to provide consumer data reporting (CAR), to be used by reporting teams Seek ways to improve Data accuracy and Reporting efficiency Enhance data monitoring, audit, and documentation to ensure data quality, and proactively identify and mitigate risk potential Perform data analysis to address reconciliation outliers.  Effectively document research performed.  Share / communicate discovery with peers, as applicable Support process development requests received from data repository owner
Required Qualifications
2+ years analytics experience demonstrated through work or military experience; or a BS/BA degree or higher in a quantitative field such as statistics, economics, operations research, mathematics, or engineering
3+ years of SQL or SAS experience
Desired Qualifications
Experience with governance and oversight requirements for regulatory and risk reporting
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Advanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skills
Other Desired Qualifications Experience in portfolio data reporting, specifically Small Business Lending portfolio Experience in portfolio data reporting, specifically Credit Card portfolio Data validation experience Knowledge of CAR data repository reporting Result-orientated to deliver, self-motivated to learn and to influence. Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment Outstanding problem solving skills with the ability to exercise independent judgment to identify and resolve problems
Job Expectations
Ability to travel up to 5% of the time
Ability to work weekends and holidays as needed or scheduled
Street AddressNC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NCTX-Irving: 5000 Riverside Drive - Irving, TXIA-West Des Moines: 7001 Westown Pkwy - West Des Moines, IAMN-Minneapolis: 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MNAZ-Tempe: 1150 W Washington St - Tempe, AZMO-Saint Louis: 1 N Jefferson Ave - Saint Louis, MO
Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
Benefits SummaryBenefits 
Visit [Link available when viewing the job] for benefits information. Performs various moderately complex activities related to business analysis and/or modeling. May perform complex analysis and/or modeling that assesses the market, credit and/or operational risk of new and existing products, maximizes profits and/or asset growth and minimizes credit and/or operating losses and other risk exposures. Provides analytical support on wholesale and/or retail credit, operating losses and other product strategies to ensure company goals are met. Segments and monitors various credit, deposit and other product groups, vintages, concentration limits, risk ratings, etc. and making recommendations to management based on those trends. Produce performance monitoring and benchmarks regarding growth, mix, delinquency, losses grade migration, and overall profitability and performance. Coordinates and consolidates the production of monthly, quarterly, and annual performance reports for senior management; reviewing and analyzing trends in current population distributions and recommending strategies. May develop more complex programming models to extract data and/or manipulate databases to provide statistical and financial modeling. May manage the roll-out of pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models for supported business or product line. May be responsible for process production, data reconciliation and model documentation in alignment with policy governance. May manage large scale cross functional/cross business unit projects and regulatory requests.
Within Corporate Risk, the Credit Consulting and Services Team is a group is seeking two Credit Risk Analytics Associates with a strong technical and data analysis skill sets. Focus of roles Credit Card portfolio and Small Business Lending. In addition to the various teams within CC&S, this position will have exposure to multiple groups across the enterprise including Finance, Consumer Credit, and Internal Audit. Team members will help ensure that key consumer data are delivered accurately within monthly time-frames, utilizing SAS/SQL code. The primary responsibilities for this role are to maintain/modify code, assemble, validate and deliver monthly data, which is used for internal and external reporting. 
Roles and Responsibilities include, but not limited to, the following:
 Partner with Risk, Technology, Finance, and Operations teams to provide consumer data reporting (CAR), to be used by reporting teams Seek ways to improve Data accuracy and Reporting efficiency Enhance data monitoring, audit, and documentation to ensure data quality, and proactively identify and mitigate risk potential Perform data analysis to address reconciliation outliers.  Effectively document research performed.  Share / communicate discovery with peers, as applicable Support process development requests received from data repository owner
Other Desired Qualifications Experience in portfolio data reporting, specifically Small Business Lending portfolio Experience in portfolio data reporting, specifically Credit Card portfolio Data validation experience Knowledge of CAR data repository reporting Result-orientated to deliver, self-motivated to learn and to influence. Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment Outstanding problem solving skills with the ability to exercise independent judgment to identify and resolve problems
Ability to work weekends and holidays as needed or scheduled
Street AddressNC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NCTX-Irving: 5000 Riverside Drive - Irving, TXIA-West Des Moines: 7001 Westown Pkwy - West Des Moines, IAMN-Minneapolis: 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MNAZ-Tempe: 1150 W Washington St - Tempe, AZMO-Saint Louis: 1 N Jefferson Ave - Saint Louis, MO
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Benefits Summary
task_skills:
As the company's second line of defense, Corporate Risk — or Independent Risk Management — provides independent oversight of risk-taking activities. Independent Risk Management establishes and maintains Wells Fargo's risk management program and provides oversight, including challenges to and independent assessment of, the frontline's execution of its risk management responsibilities. We manage risk according to the Risk Management Framework and ensure all employees understand their individual accountability for managing risk. Corporate Risk roles depend on a variety of skills, including: Data analysis and synthesis, root cause analysis, change management, process management & execution, risk governance, risk strategy, risk identification & assessment, risk prevention, controls & mitigation, risk monitoring, reporting & escalation, risk systems & technology.
Required Qualifications
Desired Qualifications
Experience with governance and oversight requirements for regulatory and risk reporting
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Advanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skills
Job Expectations
Ability to travel up to 5% of the time
Disclaimer

task_text:
Job Summary: As a Data Platform Engineer, you will implement our company-wide data strategy across all teams and departments to deliver a best-in-class data experience to our customers and partners in over 150 countries, as well as internally within our company. You will work closely with our Data Platform, Architecture and Platform Services, Data Products and Infrastructure teams to progress our Data Platform and Data Services vision to process terabytes of platform and industry data from multiple databases and origins in an automated fashion. We are in the early days of designing a data platform to accelerate all our data operations and unlock the creation of our future products, and wed love you to join us, embark and expand upon endless opportunities to innovate and drive the industry-leading, comprehensive, and global data experience for travel.   Key Responsibilities:  
  Own the end-to-end delivery of projects related to our data platform initiative, from conception and design to development and production monitoring   You will democratize access to data and aim to automate operations of large amounts of sensitive data efficiently, securely and reliably   Ship your code with our continuous integration process   Consult and partner with Operations group as they evolve maturity of our monitoring systems and processes to improve visibility and failures detection in our data platform infrastructure   Build and maintain high throughput data pipelines with state of the art technologies including but not limited to Kafka and Kafka Streams, Debezium, Cassandra, ElasticSearch, EMR, Delta Lake etc   Collaborate with Business Intelligence, Analytics, and Infrastructure teams on a daily basis  
Required Skills and Experience:  5+ years experience as a Data Platform Engineer   2+ years experience working with Amazon Web Services   You like to think at scale and design, develop and operate production data stores, messaging applications, data pipelines and data services that meet the goals of low latency, high availability, resiliency, security and quality   Hands on experience with data and platform design patterns and knowledge regarding trade-offs of using them along with any anti-patterns depending upon use cases at offer   You have know how and/or experience in building and implementing large-scale, high throughput, low latency, and secure data microservices applications   Strong Experience with Data Stream processing, Messaging platforms, and ecosystem frameworks such as Kafka and Kafka Streaming, KSQLetc   Experience on Cassandra, and ElasticSearch/Lucene   Ability to work in an Agile Scrum environment   Ability to think out of the box and learn new technology   Ability to work remotely and manage your own time in an international team   Exceptional written and verbal communication in English   Know-how of application and dimensional model implementation   Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, or other similar tools   Hands-on knowledge of ETL technologies and techniques   A background in DataOps and Service ownership, and a clear understanding of bounded contexts and how they map onto microservices   Experience moulding fresh environments into efficient mature data platforms Job Summary: As a Data Platform Engineer, you will implement our company-wide data strategy across all teams and departments to deliver a best-in-class data experience to our customers and partners in over 150 countries, as well as internally within our company. Required Skills and Experience:  5+ years experience as a Data Platform Engineer   2+ years experience working with Amazon Web Services   You like to think at scale and design, develop and operate production data stores, messaging applications, data pipelines and data services that meet the goals of low latency, high availability, resiliency, security and quality   Hands on experience with data and platform design patterns and knowledge regarding trade-offs of using them along with any anti-patterns depending upon use cases at offer   You have know how and/or experience in building and implementing large-scale, high throughput, low latency, and secure data microservices applications   Strong Experience with Data Stream processing, Messaging platforms, and ecosystem frameworks such as Kafka and Kafka Streaming, KSQLetc   Experience on Cassandra, and ElasticSearch/Lucene   Ability to work in an Agile Scrum environment   Ability to think out of the box and learn new technology   Ability to work remotely and manage your own time in an international team   Exceptional written and verbal communication in English   Know-how of application and dimensional model implementation   Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, or other similar tools   Hands-on knowledge of ETL technologies and techniques   A background in DataOps and Service ownership, and a clear understanding of bounded contexts and how they map onto microservices   Experience moulding fresh environments into efficient mature data platforms Job Summary:

task_title: Agile Team Product Owner (Operations Project Manager)
task_text:
Job Description:
Line of Business Job Description:
In this role, the Document and Workflow Operations organization (DWO) Product Owner will collaborate with DSO Development Teams, Document Content & Record Services (DCRS) Component Technical Teams, and Agile Program Product Managers within multiple active projects, across a suite of applications aligned to a large-scale imaging technology platforms. The teammate in this role will be highly organized and able to prioritize tasks effectively while serving as a liaison between Technology partners, Product Managers and FLU's. This role works closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, and with the Product Manager in a Scaled Agile Model to ensure there is alignment. An Agile Program Product Owner is responsible for maximizing value for a product and should possess a working knowledge of the product, and a basic understanding of the business or technology domain. As such, it will be advantageous for the applicant to have experience working with Technology teams, along with an understanding of development/testing functions required to enable project delivery cycles. 
Additional Responsibilities Include:
Clarifies strategic direction for the product to the responsible technology team
With guidance, communicates the product vision to stakeholders and the technology team
Collaborates with stakeholders to understand their needs and problem
Creates and prioritizes work for each assigned team, collaborating with cross-functional teams
Creates and prioritizes stories in the product backlog
Refines stories with the team to ensure there are enough “ready' stories to load the next 1-2 sprints
Works with the development team(s) to determine and communicate timelines
Reviews and accepts stories and makes on-the-spot decisions regarding scope and requirements
Works in partnership with the team to ensure that optimum value is obtained through an advanced understanding of the business
Effectively communicates with leaders, managers,peers and business partners on strategy, products, timelines and support needed
Responsible for planning, organizing and monitoring products using appropriate tools and techniques to ensure efficient and effective project completion
Supports Agile project documentation and activities
May create user guides and/or be responsible for providing information used in procedural updates 
Job Posting Description:
Manages medium-large projects for an operations segment, product line or function. Manages the research of existing operations, procedures, workflow, product and service requirements. Directs the analysis of assembled data to define problems associated with project scope. Directs project parameters, cost and resource estimates. Works closely with operations management on project impact and direction. May approve bid packages from outside vendors and contractors. Has direct management responsibility for a small project team. Requires an in-depth knowledge of the bank and overall operations environment. Required Skills:
Strong Agile experience, including the ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines is required
Strong written and verbal communications skills; comfortable interacting with all levels of leadership
Ability to navigate effectively/creatively through roadblocks in a professional, diplomatic manner
Ability to facilitate meetings, capture key outcomes/actions and own project/process documentation
Self-motivation, self-direction, organizational skills and the ability to manage priorities without sacrificing quality or timelines
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with strong attention to detail and accuracy
Effectively adapts to changing circumstances
Good foresight for detecting risks and thinking of creative ways to solve/mitigate the risks
Demonstrated ability to be detail-oriented
Ability to work with diverse team members in virtual environment
Intermediate in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) required
Ability to travel every 12 weeks to support Agile PI Planning
 
Desired Skills:
Agile SAFe Product Owner or Scrum Master Certification
Working knowledge of both Scrum and Kanban
Jira experience
Experience with Bank of America Change Management standards​
Job Band:
H5
Shift: 
1st shift (United States of America)
Hours Per Week:
40
Weekly Schedule:
Referral Bonus Amount:
0 -->

0 Job Description: Line of Business Job Description:
In this role, the Document and Workflow Operations organization (DWO) Product Owner will collaborate with DSO Development Teams, Document Content & Record Services (DCRS) Component Technical Teams, and Agile Program Product Managers within multiple active projects, across a suite of applications aligned to a large-scale imaging technology platforms. The teammate in this role will be highly organized and able to prioritize tasks effectively while serving as a liaison between Technology partners, Product Managers and FLU's. This role works closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, and with the Product Manager in a Scaled Agile Model to ensure there is alignment. An Agile Program Product Owner is responsible for maximizing value for a product and should possess a working knowledge of the product, and a basic understanding of the business or technology domain. As such, it will be advantageous for the applicant to have experience working with Technology teams, along with an understanding of development/testing functions required to enable project delivery cycles. 
Additional Responsibilities Include:
Clarifies strategic direction for the product to the responsible technology team
With guidance, communicates the product vision to stakeholders and the technology team
Collaborates with stakeholders to understand their needs and problem
Creates and prioritizes work for each assigned team, collaborating with cross-functional teams
Creates and prioritizes stories in the product backlog
Refines stories with the team to ensure there are enough “ready' stories to load the next 1-2 sprints
Works with the development team(s) to determine and communicate timelines
Reviews and accepts stories and makes on-the-spot decisions regarding scope and requirements
Works in partnership with the team to ensure that optimum value is obtained through an advanced understanding of the business
Effectively communicates with leaders, managers,peers and business partners on strategy, products, timelines and support needed
Responsible for planning, organizing and monitoring products using appropriate tools and techniques to ensure efficient and effective project completion
Supports Agile project documentation and activities
May create user guides and/or be responsible for providing information used in procedural updates 
Job Posting Description:
Manages medium-large projects for an operations segment, product line or function. Manages the research of existing operations, procedures, workflow, product and service requirements. Directs the analysis of assembled data to define problems associated with project scope. Directs project parameters, cost and resource estimates. Works closely with operations management on project impact and direction. May approve bid packages from outside vendors and contractors. Has direct management responsibility for a small project team. Requires an in-depth knowledge of the bank and overall operations environment. Required Skills:
Strong Agile experience, including the ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines is required
Strong written and verbal communications skills; comfortable interacting with all levels of leadership
Ability to navigate effectively/creatively through roadblocks in a professional, diplomatic manner
Ability to facilitate meetings, capture key outcomes/actions and own project/process documentation
Self-motivation, self-direction, organizational skills and the ability to manage priorities without sacrificing quality or timelines
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with strong attention to detail and accuracy
Effectively adapts to changing circumstances
Good foresight for detecting risks and thinking of creative ways to solve/mitigate the risks
Demonstrated ability to be detail-oriented
Ability to work with diverse team members in virtual environment
Intermediate in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) required
Ability to travel every 12 weeks to support Agile PI Planning
 
Desired Skills:
Agile SAFe Product Owner or Scrum Master Certification
Working knowledge of both Scrum and Kanban
Jira experience
Experience with Bank of America Change Management standards​

Directs the analysis of assembled data to define problems associated with project scope. Directs project parameters, cost and resource estimates. Works closely with operations management on project impact and direction. May approve bid packages from outside vendors and contractors. Has direct management responsibility for a small project team. Requires an in-depth knowledge of the bank and overall operations environment. Required Skills:
Strong Agile experience, including the ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines is required
Ability to navigate effectively/creatively through roadblocks in a professional, diplomatic manner
Ability to facilitate meetings, capture key outcomes/actions and own project/process documentation
Effectively adapts to changing circumstances
Good foresight for detecting risks and thinking of creative ways to solve/mitigate the risks
Job Band:
1st shift (United States of America)
Hours Per Week:
In this role, the Document and Workflow Operations organization (DWO) Product Owner will collaborate with DSO Development Teams, Document Content & Record Services (DCRS) Component Technical Teams, and Agile Program Product Managers within multiple active projects, across a suite of applications aligned to a large-scale imaging technology platforms. The teammate in this role will be highly organized and able to prioritize tasks effectively while serving as a liaison between Technology partners, Product Managers and FLU's. This role works closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, and with the Product Manager in a Scaled Agile Model to ensure there is alignment. An Agile Program Product Owner is responsible for maximizing value for a product and should possess a working knowledge of the product, and a basic understanding of the business or technology domain. As such, it will be advantageous for the applicant to have experience working with Technology teams, along with an understanding of development/testing functions required to enable project delivery cycles. 
Additional Responsibilities Include:
Clarifies strategic direction for the product to the responsible technology team
With guidance, communicates the product vision to stakeholders and the technology team
Collaborates with stakeholders to understand their needs and problem
Creates and prioritizes work for each assigned team, collaborating with cross-functional teams
Creates and prioritizes stories in the product backlog
Refines stories with the team to ensure there are enough “ready' stories to load the next 1-2 sprints
Works with the development team(s) to determine and communicate timelines
Reviews and accepts stories and makes on-the-spot decisions regarding scope and requirements
Works in partnership with the team to ensure that optimum value is obtained through an advanced understanding of the business
Effectively communicates with leaders, managers,peers and business partners on strategy, products, timelines and support needed
Responsible for planning, organizing and monitoring products using appropriate tools and techniques to ensure efficient and effective project completion
Supports Agile project documentation and activities
May create user guides and/or be responsible for providing information used in procedural updates

Strong written and verbal communications skills; comfortable interacting with all levels of leadership
Self-motivation, self-direction, organizational skills and the ability to manage priorities without sacrificing quality or timelines

Demonstrated ability to be detail-oriented
Ability to work with diverse team members in virtual environment
Intermediate in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) required
Ability to travel every 12 weeks to support Agile PI Planning

Working knowledge of both Scrum and Kanban
Jira experience

task_text:
UST Global® is looking for talented Senior Business Analyst and will be working with one of the leading technology providers in the US. The ideal candidate should have the ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment. The ideal candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability and knowhow to collaborate effectively with domain experts and IT leadership team. 
Qualifications 
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Data Driver Operating Model Product Management team as we continue to propel the business through near real time influential sales and marketing data and insights sourcing from MicroSoft Dynamics. This individual will lead a wide range of activities in support of business decisions and management reporting. You will partner closely with senior level business and technology leaders to work through all aspects of data product and reporting. In this role, you will develop and streamline consistent processes, 
What you need to succeed 
Data Product Management Skills 
 Prioritize and respond to input from multiple sources and use analytical abilities to evaluate alternatives to make compelling recommendations. You'll be creating and sharing the product roadmap in front of large internal and external audiences; and need to distill complex issues into clear recommendations. Work within the framework of the Project Management standards to deliver business needs quickly. \'Prior understanding of CRM Micro Soft Dynamics Data objects with marketing and sales analytics experience or Have a good understanding of SAP Quote to Cash processes Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets using SQL and experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI and Tableau Perform regular ad-hoc data querying and analysis to better understand customer behaviors including acquisition, engagement, conversion and retention\' 3+ years of functional or data experience with attention to detail and strong understanding of how data solves for analytical and operational use cases in Marketing, Sales, Finance, Product development, or Customer Care 6-7 + years of functional understanding of SFDC sales and opportunity management , SAP order to cash process and good understanding of subscrption business model and be able to drive cross-functional team initiatives end to end with very minimal guidance within weeks (2-3weeks) Knowledgeable about the subscription business model, engagement and product usage metrics, and data requirements that drive personalized messaging and experiences (e.g. profile-based customer segmentation and A/B testing methodologies) Self-starter, independent, proactive, results-oriented, hard worker, a high degree of motivations to go above and beyond the task at hand, Excellent verbal and written communication - ability to tell story to obtain consensus to drive task/projects   BSA skills relevant to data and analytics including performance optimization with a deep knowledge and experience of data technology platforms such as SQL is required, and Hadoop is preferred Experience developing reports using various BI Tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, or Power BI Product Management and Executive Presentation skills 3+ years hands-on experience with business intelligence tools (Tableau, power BI etc.) 3 + years hands-on experience with OLAP / multi-dimensional data cubes Great interpersonal communication. You'll be interacting with everyone from senior leadership to program management, engineering, and client teams, and providing briefings and roadmap updates to influence stakeholder buy-in. Great presentation skills. You'll be sharing the product roadmap and strategy in front of large internal and external audiences; and need to distill complex issues into clear recommendations. Skilled in collecting, documenting and prioritizing requirements in an agile framework, and responding to input from multiple sources (customers, testers, engineering, competitive products, management, etc.)  Strong understanding of big data platforms (Hadoop, Redshift, etc.) and both streaming & ETL processes, and familiarity with SQL/Python and experience with business intelligence tools like Tableau or Power BI Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment and to build and manage cross functional relationships.  Experience in tech companies with mixed deployment products (on-prem, cloud, etc.) for a basic level of business context Strong analytical skills and a drive to Innovate; demonstrated ability to use data to drive decision making in product development Ability to manage complex builds through thoughtful prioritization and disciplines that drive towards delivery Hands-on experience using databases and related technologies in a fast-paced multi-application business environment with large-scale and complex data-sets. task_text:
Long term position as a  Software Engineer - Remote (within U.S.) W2 employee, no Corp to Corp   
 You will be working within a professional team which is developing innovative technology-based asset management solutions for clients in a variety of industries worldwide. Specifically, you will be responsible for: 
 
 • Work independently or under only general direction in a fast-paced and flexible environment with tight deadlines and changing priorities 
 • Liaise with system analysts and business owners to improve applications and establish best practices • Participate in all stages of the development life cycle, from concept planning to build, testing, delivery debugging and documentation 
 • Write programming code to fulfill client requirements 
 • Participate in code reviews with our senior application developers and modify your programming code according to their feedback 
• B.S. in the field of Computer Science or relevant field of study 
• At least 5 years of related experience 
• Oral communication skills to effectively explain technical concepts required 
• An ability to understand front-end users’ requirements and problem-solving attitude 
• Must be highly motivated and enjoy working in a team environment.
Must be eligible to work in the US.  No H1B Visa Applicants.  Must be able to pass a drug screen and background check. 
• C# / .NET programming experience 
• Strong object-oriented design skills 
• Experience with web-related technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, JSON, Ajax, etc.) in the ASP.NET Core framework 
• Familiarity with relational database design and development • Proficiency in full stack (front-end, back-end) web development 
• Experience with the Model View ViewModel design pattern Ideally, You’ll Also Have: 
• M.S. in the field of Computer Science or relevant field of study 
• At least 10 years of related experience • Experience working in an agile (e.g. Scrum) environment 
• Experience with Telerik UI Controls • Experience with CM tools such as GitHub 
• Microsoft Certified Developer Associate or greater certification Long term position as a  Software Engineer - Remote (within U.S.) W2 employee, no Corp to Corp

task_text:
RetailData partners with the largest retailers in the world to provide competitive intelligence solutions. With consumers dynamically shifting their purchasing patterns between the various in-store and e-commerce sales channels, we are perpetually innovating new solutions and products to meet client needs. Our industry-leading expertise in price, assortment and promotional data sets, in conjunction with our expansive technology and analytics platforms, has positioned us perfectly to help retailers navigate these unprecedented retail changes.
 
 Description: 
We are immediately hiring part time Field Representatives in your area! Are you a military spouse and looking for supplemental income?   Make extra spending money to help with your car payment, social activities, and more!  
Benefits: 
 Thorough training on collecting in store. Ability to control what you earn. Advanced notice of work schedule. $400 referral bonus program. As a part-time team member, you are offered identity theft protection, pet insurance, and 401k with match after 6 months and 750 hours worked. Employee stock purchase after 1 year of service. Independent, flexible work schedules that enable a healthy work-life balance. Travel opportunities, locally and out of state. Extra hours available in many areas.  Paid drive time and mileage reimbursement. 
Come work for an essential business!  We put an emphasis on A.R.T = Accountability, Respect, Trust! 
Requirements: 
 At least 18 years of age. High school diploma, or equivalent. Valid driver's license, clean driving record, reliable transportation, and valid automobile insurance. Ability to work approximately 10 - 25 hours per week with scheduling flexibility. Reliability to start and finish assignments on time with the detail needed to satisfy the project criteria. Ability to stand throughout the work shift and lift up to 40 pounds intermittently. Willingness to work in cold temperatures associated with grocery store refrigerator and freezer cases as some projects required collection of items in these store aisles. 
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: RetailData is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or sexual orientation.

Ability to work approximately 10 - 25 hours per week with scheduling flexibility. Reliability to start and finish assignments on time with the detail needed to satisfy the project criteria. Ability to stand throughout the work shift and lift up to 40 pounds intermittently. Willingness to work in cold temperatures associated with grocery store refrigerator and freezer cases as some projects required collection of items in these store aisles.
