One day someone is going to ask you where you got your start…This is IT!
With a wide range of Fortune 500 enterprises, government organizations and top systems integrators as our clients, we not only provide you with the skills needed to succeed through an employer-paid training program  but will also give you the opportunity to put those skills to use, on projects that matter.
What We Are Looking For
College degree (Associates or Bachelors)
Must be authorized to work in the US
Strong desire to learn to code – No prior professional experience required. 
A natural problem solver
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Willing to relocate anywhere in the US – Relocation assistance provided
What We Offer
Competitive salary
Relocation & housing assistance
Health, vision & dental insurance
Paid time off
Industry Certifications
Life Insurance Policy
401k
Mentoring program and ongoing support throughout your entire Revature career
Experience with the largest and most reputable companies in the US
Apply Today. Interviews are going on now.#SoftwareEngineering
Equal Employment Opportunity
The Company is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. task_text:
SummaryS/He is to lead and/or participate in the design and implementation of computer and information networks, such as local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), intranets, extranets, and other data communications networks. Active participation in collaborative solutions that require integrated infrastructure solutions. Perform network modeling, analysis, and planning, including review of capacity needs for network infrastructures. Include security best practices and company security requirements within design solutions. Research and recommend network and data communications hardware and software.
Description
 Develop & produce conceptual, logical, and/or physical network architecture/solution designs in support of Business & IT Global requirements 
 Participate in and lead technical discussions to understand business requirements and translate them into functional requirements that includes both detailed and big picture scoped items such as Business Continuity plans
Create conceptual diagrams and presentation material for collaboritive and inter-team use as well as management presentations
Be comfortable presenting these concepts to management and various I.T. teams demonstrating the alternatives and the benefits of the preferred approaches
Collaborate with other teams for integrated technology solutions involving networking; collaborate with other (vendor) designers of inter-connected networks
Develop or recommend network security measures, such as firewalls, network-based threat protection; ensure designs are in alignment with security best practices and company-adopted security practices
Research new networking technologies to determine what would best support their organization in the future via producing technology road-maps; stay current with technology trends, company use cases, and market forces to recommend, modify and implement relevant solutions to align with company business goals.
Review, contribute, and consult to engineering diagrams and layouts for data communications networks
Obtain a thorough understanding of existing company networks and become familiar with the company's business plans in order to help achieve business goals
Mentor engineering/implementation teams as needed for new deployment features or functionality or best-practices
 Be capable of troubleshooting complex Network/Collaboration technology issues and respond if called into a Severity production outage.
 Effectively demonstrate excellent communications skills; oral, written, and presentations to Architectural peers, Engineering/Implementation staff, and all layers of Management.
 Teamwork: We foster a collaborative, respectful work environment that brings together our diverse talents and extends to our customer relationships. We believe that when everyone is working together, success follows.
Technology Familiarity Software
 Network management - (e.g., Cisco DNAc, CiscoWorks; Riverbed; Solarwinds)
Network monitoring tracing - (SNMP; packet analysis software, Wireshark, Extrahop)
 Operating systems - (Linux; MS Windows, Apple (MacOS, iOS,watchOS, tvOS)
Network OS - (IOS, NXOS, IOS-XE, EOS, Meraki)
 Middleware Solutions - Apache Tomcat; Google AngularJS; Javascript; MS ASP.NET Core MVC
 Application Containers -- Docker
 Technical Knowledge
 Telecommunications - knowledge of transmission, broadcasting, switching, control, and operation of telecommunication systems.
 Computers and Electronics - Knowledge of circuit boards, processors, chips, electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programing.
 Engineering and Technology - Knowledge of the practical aplication of engineering and science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, performance testing methodologies, procedures, evaluation techniques, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
Job Environment
 Complex routing, switching, and ISP environments
Cisco Routers (ISRs and ASRs)
Campus Switches - Cisco, Meraki
Data Center Switching - Cisco & Arista (preferred)
EVPN design, configuration; spine and leaf
Firewalls (Palo Alto preferred, Cisco ASA/Meraki desirable)
Load Balancing (F5 preferred)
QoS understanding and configuration (routers and switches)
Routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, EIGRP)
WAN architectures ("legacy" ex: MPLS and "trending" ex: SD-WAN & VPN methods)
Thorough understanding of most enterprise IPv4 protocols and emerging IPv6 deployments
Strong familiarity with cloud networking (AWS: VPC, Transit Gateways, Direct Connect, ELB/ALB, Route 53)
Multicast PIM, MSDP
Familiarity with network configuration, automation tooling, telemetry, authentication technologies (Cisco DNA center, Cisco ISE, Cisco Umbrella, Cisco Stealthwatch, Arista CloudVision, InfoBlox IPAM & NetMRI, F5 BigIQ, Splunk)
 Familiarity with Network Troubleshooting Tool Suites (Extrahop, Gigamon, "Wire Data" visibility tool suites, Syslog Parsers, AKiPS, etc.)
  Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree preferred
 8 or more years of relevant job experience including analyzing, configuring, troubleshooting, designing complex enterprose networks
 Industry certifications -- primarily via our Strategic Partners (Arista, Cisco/Meraki, F5, InfoBlox, Palo Alto, Velocloud, vmware)
 CCIE and CCDE (preferred)
 CCNP (routing/switching), CCNP(wireless)
 PAN PCSNE
 other (JNCIS, VCP, F5, AWS, Meraki, Advanced Networking)
 Must be highly knowledgeable in IP networking, enterprise IT architecture, VPN, Routers, Switches, Load Balancers, Firewalls and other security appliances SummaryS/He is to lead and/or participate in the design and implementation of computer and information networks, such as local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), intranets, extranets, and other data communications networks. Engineering and Technology - Knowledge of the practical aplication of engineering and science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, performance testing methodologies, procedures, evaluation techniques, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.    Job Environment   Complex routing, switching, and ISP environments
task_experience:
SummaryS/He is to lead and/or participate in the design and implementation of computer and information networks, such as local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), intranets, extranets, and other data communications networks. Active participation in collaborative solutions that require integrated infrastructure solutions. Perform network modeling, analysis, and planning, including review of capacity needs for network infrastructures. Include security best practices and company security requirements within design solutions. Research and recommend network and data communications hardware and software.
 Develop & produce conceptual, logical, and/or physical network architecture/solution designs in support of Business & IT Global requirements 
 Participate in and lead technical discussions to understand business requirements and translate them into functional requirements that includes both detailed and big picture scoped items such as Business Continuity plans
Be comfortable presenting these concepts to management and various I.T. teams demonstrating the alternatives and the benefits of the preferred approaches
Collaborate with other teams for integrated technology solutions involving networking; collaborate with other (vendor) designers of inter-connected networks
Develop or recommend network security measures, such as firewalls, network-based threat protection; ensure designs are in alignment with security best practices and company-adopted security practices
Research new networking technologies to determine what would best support their organization in the future via producing technology road-maps; stay current with technology trends, company use cases, and market forces to recommend, modify and implement relevant solutions to align with company business goals.
Review, contribute, and consult to engineering diagrams and layouts for data communications networks
Obtain a thorough understanding of existing company networks and become familiar with the company's business plans in order to help achieve business goals
Mentor engineering/implementation teams as needed for new deployment features or functionality or best-practices
 Be capable of troubleshooting complex Network/Collaboration technology issues and respond if called into a Severity production outage.
 Effectively demonstrate excellent communications skills; oral, written, and presentations to Architectural peers, Engineering/Implementation staff, and all layers of Management.
 Teamwork: We foster a collaborative, respectful work environment that brings together our diverse talents and extends to our customer relationships. We believe that when everyone is working together, success follows.

task_skills:
Description
Create conceptual diagrams and presentation material for collaboritive and inter-team use as well as management presentations
Technology Familiarity Software
 Network management - (e.g., Cisco DNAc, CiscoWorks; Riverbed; Solarwinds)
Network monitoring tracing - (SNMP; packet analysis software, Wireshark, Extrahop)
 Operating systems - (Linux; MS Windows, Apple (MacOS, iOS,watchOS, tvOS)
Network OS - (IOS, NXOS, IOS-XE, EOS, Meraki)
 Middleware Solutions - Apache Tomcat; Google AngularJS; Javascript; MS ASP.NET Core MVC
 Application Containers -- Docker
 Technical Knowledge
Job Environment
 Complex routing, switching, and ISP environments
Cisco Routers (ISRs and ASRs)
Data Center Switching - Cisco & Arista (preferred)
EVPN design, configuration; spine and leaf
Firewalls (Palo Alto preferred, Cisco ASA/Meraki desirable)
Load Balancing (F5 preferred)
QoS understanding and configuration (routers and switches)
Routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, EIGRP)
WAN architectures ("legacy" ex: MPLS and "trending" ex: SD-WAN & VPN methods)
Thorough understanding of most enterprise IPv4 protocols and emerging IPv6 deployments
Strong familiarity with cloud networking (AWS: VPC, Transit Gateways, Direct Connect, ELB/ALB, Route 53)
Multicast PIM, MSDP
Familiarity with network configuration, automation tooling, telemetry, authentication technologies (Cisco DNA center, Cisco ISE, Cisco Umbrella, Cisco Stealthwatch, Arista CloudVision, InfoBlox IPAM & NetMRI, F5 BigIQ, Splunk)
 Familiarity with Network Troubleshooting Tool Suites (Extrahop, Gigamon, "Wire Data" visibility tool suites, Syslog Parsers, AKiPS, etc.)
 CCIE and CCDE (preferred)
 CCNP (routing/switching), CCNP(wireless)
 PAN PCSNE

STRATEGIC STAFFING SOLUTIONS (S3) HAS AN OPENING!Title: Senior Java DeveloperLocation: San Leandro, CA/ Chandler, AZ/ Summit, NJ Contract Length: 24 MonthsRequired Qualifications:
10 years of Java server-side development experience
10 years of experience working with Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) such a SQL Server, Oracle or MySQL
7 years of micro-services development experience
7 years of Spring batch development experience
7 years of experience with Kafka (PubSub patterns tools)
5 years of Agile experience
10 years of software engineering experience
Additionally experience with the CI/CD and DevOps tools : GitHub, uDeploy, Jenkins, Eclipse, Sonar, BlackDuck, Aritfactory etc.
Desired Qualifications:
Ability to quickly establish credibility to build and maintain effective working relationships
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Knowledge and understanding of technical documentation: impact analysis, detailed designs and unit test plans
Ability to grasp complex business issues quickly, recommend solutions, and drive for resolutions
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
TO APPLY: Please email your resume in Word Format to Paul Larson at [Link available when viewing the job]  and Reference Job Order #: 185543. task_text:
**Only U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. can be considered as W2 candidates.**Position Title: Volunteer Recruitment SupportLocation: New Haven – CT, 06511Duration: 12 Months
The Volunteer Recruitment Support assists the colleagues working in the Business Operations department for all recruitment related activities of trial subjects:
Database development and maintenance, pre selection of suitable study candidates, organize recruitment related activities pre-, per- and post study. 
Supports clinical trials by drafting/using different recruitment related documents, performs administrative activities
Contributes to compliance of regulatory requirements related to the protection of volunteer’s confidential data
JOB RESPONSIBILITIESIndicate the primary responsibilities critical to the job.Subject/Patient Database Maintenance
 SME in database query, ensures all information is entered consistently and correctly so that database is searchable with reliable information
 Assists in development and maintenance of the PCRU subject recruitment capabilities to conduct a broad range of studies
 Assists in the identification, exploration and implementation of new methods for subject recruitment to extend the panel
 May assist in the implementation of recruitment campaigns, including the design, drafting & publication of advertisements in various media.
 Maintain accuracy, accessibility, and confidentiality of volunteer records and reports
 May act as a primary contact person for new potential volunteers, responsibilities include:- Answering incoming calls from potential volunteers responding to any methods of recruitment,- Inform them about the unit activity, the overall recruitment process and studies,- Enters gathered information accurately into the database;
 Must be able to process new requests from different media (Internet platform and others).
 Contacts volunteers already listed in the database for proactive engagement, answers questions about the clinical trial process. Inform potential volunteers on the next steps and/or scheduled appointments and how to reach the clinical research unit.
Recruitment and Screening Activities (overseen by Supervisor)
 Provide support to internal clinical research staff in the pre-selection of subjects for eligibility using protocol inclusion/exclusion criteria;
 Communicate protocol requirements to study subjects and patients calling to inquire about specific studies;
 May create and manage various communication methods to subjects, including but not limited to letters, text messaging, and mailings;
 Manage subject phone calls including scheduling/rescheduling of appointments;
 Responsible for meeting timelines required for filling specific study screenings and for filling cohorts and groups for dosing.
 Provides training to less experienced phone screen staff when needed and demonstrates ability to problem solve.
 Maintains a positive and professional attitude to the subject population, understanding they are the first contact subjects have with the CRU;
 Track phone call metrics from sources of advertising so that advertising strategies can be decided based on what is most effective;
 May write and update recruitment related documents for subject use as appropriate
 Communicate protocol requirements to study subjects and contribute to compliance
 Demonstrate positive attitude to the subject population to ensure subject’s trust in clinical research
Support Clinical Trials (under responsibility of the Principal Investigator)
 Assist in the conduct of clinical trials in the PCRU
 May obtain signed informed consent from candidate trial-subjects
 May assist in staff scheduling as appropriate
 May assist in the data management/cleaning activities for assigned protocols
 Identify new options to problem solving and execution of the protocol
 Document individual subject’s participation while involved in study activities
 Responsible for recording study data, maintaining source documentation, and updating subject database, not only specific to study participationOther
 Participate in community outreach efforts
 Assist in development and maintenance of social media presence including managing all website updates (managing ads, posting new content etc.)
 Assist in the increase of the unit awareness
 Participate in PCRU teams to accomplish business needs and resolve issues
 Ensure data collection of high quality and transfer to relevant departments
 Ability to take over and manage other specific projects
 Participate in the communication and study related meetings
 Ensure clinical trials are conducted in accordance with scientific, medical, and ethical principles, within regulatory requirements/guidelines, and Pfizer SOPs
 May participate in the different administrative parts related to the execution of Phase I clinical studies.
 Support ongoing capture and analysis of metrics to demonstrate value and increase productivity
 40 hour position; includes some weekend and evening hours;
 Represents the PCRU on global initiatives as subject matter expert, as appropriate
 May participate in the communication and study related meetings
 May participate in the different financial matters, including purchasing/orders management, contact with suppliers, budgets set up and management, monthly expenses justification, bank account management, payment of subjects
 May act as a receptionist.
 Supports ongoing capture and analysis of metrics to demonstrate value and increase productivity
 Participates in the creation and implementation of global and local SOPs
Rose International is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender (expression or identity), national origin, arrest and conviction records, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Positions located in San Francisco and Los Angeles, California will be administered in accordance with their respective Fair Chance Ordinances. Rose International has an official agreement (ID #132522), effective June 30, 2008, with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Employment Verification Program (E-Verify). (Posting required by OCGA 13/10-91.) **Only U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. can be considered as W2 candidates.**Position Title: Volunteer Recruitment SupportLocation: New Haven – CT, 06511Duration: 12 Months

task_text:
Manufacturing Company in Union County is looking for the following: Marketing Distributor & B2B Professional (Automotive & Industry) Salary- $65-75k Situation in organisation N+1 : Marketing Manager N+2 : President Member of Marketing Team & report to the Marketing Manager Develop marketing tools and materials to support sales, business development and the customer satisfaction within the Distributors & B2B segments. 
Assist, support & propose digital promotional programs (customers & prospects)
Propose tools & marketing contents to develop Sales with & for the Distributors Network (TDP)
Propose tools & marketing contents to improve the sales in B2B
Propose tools & marketing contents to improve the visibility of the Automotive & Industrial products line on the B2B
Propose tools & marketing contents to improve the number of visitors or followers in the different Platforms B2B
Analyse the different tools proposed or available by the lubricants business line or Total Energies M&S and proposed the implementation in the company
Assist with internal support departments and external vendors to reach or exceed marketing project goals
Attend trade shows/exhibitions and sponsorship events if needed
Take care of the Marketing budget & manage invoices for the M&D projects activity
Work closely with the other members of the marketing team
Work closely with the Products Manager for Automotive & Industry, to update contents
Work closely with the Key Account Managers to develop program dedicated to our global customers
US lubricants Market is the second largest market in the world, The company has 1% of market share. With some recent acquisitions and partnerships TEMUSA will improve his visibility on the industrial market and in Automotive Aftermarket (Retail Shops & wholesalers). Very diversified customers & prospects portfolio (Distributors, Retailers, OEM's manufacturers/dealerships, industry giant, …) Global guidelines for Branding & communication. 
Marketing Activities for Distributors Network
Improvement of TE visibility in the distributors network
Marketing for B2B activities
Trade shows for B2B
E-commerce Sales increase
Skills: Inter-personal and communication skills, self-motivated, accountability, Microsoft Office, In addition the incumbent should be proficient in Adobe Suite, HTML, iMovie, Premier, or similar video editing software. Past meeting, sponsorship, event and trade show marketing/coordination is a plus. Strong working knowledge of marketing and promotional techniques is essential. Technical aptitude will be beneficial. Experience: 2-5 years' business experience is strongly preferred. Experience in technical product management, market management and/or marketing is preferred. Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited university/college is required. task_text:
Network and Systems Administration Location: Broomfield, CO Type: Direct Hire Compensation: 65k to 110k, Benefits   Position Summary: Responsible for the design, implementation, monitoring and upgrading of network and system hardware and software. Acts as a tier two / three escalation point for all systems and network issues related issues. Recommends and designs hardware and software upgrades as it relates to normal system lifecycles.   Essential Functions:  Implements, configures, updates, troubleshoots, and supports enterprise software such as active directory, Exchange, SQL, and both on premises and cloud based virtualization technologies. Implements, configures, updates, troubleshoots, and supports network hardware and software such as switches, routers, and firewalls, VPN's, and related systems. Implements, configures, updates, troubleshoots, and supports system level hardware including physical servers, PC's, storage, backup hardware and related datacenter equipment. Develops and deploys all systems software and updates using industry standard tools and resources. Understanding of standard scripting languages and automation technologies such as PowerShell, python, vbscript, Ansible, etc Able to plan and execute all levels of deployments of systems and devices from start to finish. Maintains enterprise level backups of all systems and infrastructure components to support credit union needs. Assists users in accessing, installing, and securing network resources. Provide phone, e-mail, and in-person support and training to end users ensuring their needs are met as a tier 3 escalation point. Inform management of area activities. Notify supervisor of system malfunctions and operating problems that could result in end user impact. Maintains system and network security and availability based on established policy and industry standard guidelines. Keep availability of computer systems within the accepted range and implement approved changes that will benefit the department and Credit Union.    QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or the equivalent combination of education and experience Knowledge of Active Directory, storage, Windows, Linux. Knowledge of security best practices and standards such as NIST, CIS, FFIEC. Strong understanding of TCP/ IP, IP address provisioning and management, routing, switching, and firewalls. Understanding of Credit Union operations and output requirements a plus. Industry standard certifications such as CCNP, MCSE, AWS Solutions Architect, or equivalent a plus. 3+ years related experience preferred.  Skills/Abilities:  Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments in an environment that requires multitasking among concurrent projects. Able to communicate complex information clearly with all levels of staff organization wide. Good process orientation and ability to clarify objectives, evaluate options, consider implications, assess risks, and make key decisions. Sound planning, organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills. Willingness to participate in an on call rotation as well as work after hours as necessary. Strong customer service skills and willingness to assist others. Honesty, integrity, and transparency are required at all times. Ability to follow policy and regulatory requirements.    EEOC: We are committed to equal employment opportunity without consideration of race, color, religion, ethnicity, citizenship, political activity or affiliation, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, sex or gender, or any other basis protected by law. task_text:
Join our team, as a Surgical Coordinator! At our Whitten Laser Eye practice in Richmond, Virginia, you'll join a team of innovative and accomplished providers, surgeons, and clinical care staff. We are looking for a passionate, patient focused individual to join a busy but amazing team where your work makes a real difference!  
We Believe In Rewarding Excellence! You will be rewarded with career growth opportunities. To be successful, you'll need excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You'll earn a competitive salary and an excellent benefit package too! You'll have comprehensive insurance plans, HSA option, continuing education fund, eye care benefits, paid-time-off, paid holidays and 401(k). 
Responsibilities: 
Liaison to patients; assist with completion of paperwork; create, update, and maintain accurate patient files; update database systems, schedule and confirm appointments as necessary.
Assist patients regarding surgery dates, book patients for Lasik consultations and surgery, discuss pre and post-op instructions with patients. 
Communicate with patients surgical pricing and answer questions about payment and financing. 
Handle timely follow-up to prospective, current and past patients. 
Prepare patient charts for surgery and provide caring help to patients before, during and after surgery. 
Collect surgery payments; process financing through financial software programs; maintain monthly and yearly financial reports. 
Ensure all patients, at all times, have a positive experience while in the office or on the phone. 
Qualifications: 
Must be patient service focused with the ability to deliver high patient satisfaction. 
Excellent communications skills required, ability to develop relationships with patients to provide a positive experience. 
Ability and confidence to present pricing and financing. 
Ophthalmic/optometric experience is preferred but not required. 
Proficient with standard office equipment and software (Word & Excel); multi-task comfortably; ability to work with a high degree of professionalism. 
Exemplary organizational skills; willingness to be cross-trained and fill in for other staff members. 
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are looking for a passionate, patient focused individual to join a busy but amazing team where your work makes a real difference!  
We Believe In Rewarding Excellence! You will be rewarded with career growth opportunities. To be successful, you'll need excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You'll earn a competitive salary and an excellent benefit package too! You'll have comprehensive insurance plans, HSA option, continuing education fund, eye care benefits, paid-time-off, paid holidays and 401(k). 
Liaison to patients; assist with completion of paperwork; create, update, and maintain accurate patient files; update database systems, schedule and confirm appointments as necessary.
Assist patients regarding surgery dates, book patients for Lasik consultations and surgery, discuss pre and post-op instructions with patients. 
Communicate with patients surgical pricing and answer questions about payment and financing. 
Handle timely follow-up to prospective, current and past patients. 
Prepare patient charts for surgery and provide caring help to patients before, during and after surgery. 
Collect surgery payments; process financing through financial software programs; maintain monthly and yearly financial reports. 
Ensure all patients, at all times, have a positive experience while in the office or on the phone. 
Must be patient service focused with the ability to deliver high patient satisfaction. 
Excellent communications skills required, ability to develop relationships with patients to provide a positive experience. 
Ability and confidence to present pricing and financing. 
Ophthalmic/optometric experience is preferred but not required. 
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

task_text:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message.  In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application. 
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.
Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.
The position is for a senior developer in the Equity Derivatives Technology group to work in the derivatives front office risk team responsible for building the strategic Risk & Pricing platform for all the Derivative desks including Index & Single Stock Flow, Delta-1, Convertibles, Corporates, & Structured OTC/Notes and provide technical solutions for all the other applications in the ecosystem to transition the flows to the new platform requires very strong technical knowledge of Java and a solid foundation of server design methodologies. Must be able to write highly functional and performant code in a structured manner that can be applied to domains beyond equity derivatives. Successful applicant will help enhance, build and deliver application frameworks and specific functionality around trading and risk.  
Candidates applying for this position should be prepared to work in this software environment with the following expectations:
 Perform in the high level technical and analytics role as an individual contributor developing software for the various trading components Work directly with business analysts, traders, sales, operations group to understand requirements Read and understand business specifications and create functional specifications from them Create thorough designs - taking care to assure that designs integrate well into existing architecture Write high quality code in the Java language using object oriented principals and design patterns as appropriate Create/modify SQL Server database objects (tables, views, stored procedures, etc)  Perform high quality thorough unit testing and documentation of development activities Work on complex problems where analysis of situations and/or data requires a solid grasp of business/risk domains Assure quality, maintainability, and extensibility for supported systems and risk applications Provide Level 2 production support as required 
Required Qualifications
5+ years of software engineering experience
3 + years of Core Java experience
Desired Qualifications
An industry-standard technology certification
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
A BS/BA degree or higher in information technology
1+ year of Python experience
Derivatives experience
Knowledge and understanding of price distribution mechanisms, market access, low latency trading and pricing
Knowledge and understanding of technology architecture: distributed and client server technologies
1+ year of Autosys experience
Other Desired Qualifications Good interpersonal skills Team player that works across geographically diverse teams. Ability to work across different groups including Technology, Operations, Quants and Trading.  3+ years of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) experience 2+ years of distributed servers platform experience
Street AddressNJ-North Brunswick: 100 Fidelity Plz - North Brunswick, NJNY-New York: 150 E 42nd St - New York, NY
Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
Benefits SummaryBenefits 
Visit [Link available when viewing the job] for benefits information.

task_text:
MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.
Summary
The Senior Security Engineer, part of the Corporate Security Group, is primarily charged with ensuring critical technology systems and networks are sufficiently monitored for compliance to existing information security safeguards. 
Email resume and a summary of your relevant experience to MadisonHaberl @ MichaelPage.US.com.
Client Details
A leading financial service firm. 
Email resume and a summary of your relevant experience to MadisonHaberl @ MichaelPage.US.com.
Description
Collaborate across teams to define, track and report on activities relating to data usage, system access, configuration changes, services, issues, incidents, threats, etc.
Define and maintain portfolio of vulnerability management, SIEM, automation and authentication tools. Conduct or assist in forensic investigations, event management, spam investigation, threat management, penetration testing, proactive defense, network sensor auditing, etc.
Spearhead a culture of security awareness among technologists at all levels, coach and mentor technical personnel in the use of automation.
Create, develop and enhance Start of Day, Start of Week and other regular reporting of key security focused metrics (KRIs) and own the improvement of security of systems and networks.
Respond to high-priority requests for information and assurance from stakeholders including ascertaining relevant technical facts from distributed systems and network components.
Responsible for ensuring all systems and devices on network are adequately patched and protected from malicious software and other intrusion attempts.
Assist in the selection of technology systems, software and components enterprise wide.
Email resume and a summary of your relevant experience to MadisonHaberl @ MichaelPage.US.com.
Profile
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline.
Thorough hands-on experience in security engineering domain, IT operations and deep technical knowledge.
Knowledge of cryptography and encryption products, data loss prevention, mobile device management.
Deep functional and practical experience with scripting and automation techniques with advanced knowledge of
PowerShell, VBScript, PERL, Python, or similar.
Information security experience from financial service firm is preferred.
Knowledge and experience of SIEM tools, vulnerability management platforms, network security platforms, firewalls,
IDS/IPS, web proxies and internet content filtering.
Thorough knowledge of operating systems (Microsoft, Linux, Unix), email, SFTP, SSL, Identity and Access
Management, Oracle OAM.
Full-stack knowledge of IT infrastructure, including but not limited to cloud services (AWS/Azure), IP networks,
applications, databases, operating systems.
Email resume and a summary of your relevant experience to MadisonHaberl @ MichaelPage.US.com.
Influencing skills and proven ability to work in a matrix organizational structure.
Familiarity with Network Design, Firewalls, Routers and general network design and security issues.
Proficiency with MS Office Tools including Visio and PowerPoint.
Effective communication across the organization, including to the highest levels of senior management.
Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities and to
effectively prioritize and execute against timelines in a nimble and fast-paced environment.
The successful candidate will have 7-10 years related experience as systems/network engineer and at least 2 years as
systems administrator.
Relevant certifications - CISSP, CISA or equivalent and
Job Offer
Compensation is competitive and based upon experience. 
Email resume and a summary of your relevant experience to MadisonHaberl @ MichaelPage.US.com. MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Summary

task_text:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message.  In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application. 
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.
Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.
The Enterprise Application Security Program enhances the ability of the development organization to consistently deliver highly functional applications that are secure and resilient against attack. We develop the policies, processes, and tools to proactively embed security into Wells Fargo-developed applications. The person in this role is a key member of the Secure Software Group who will manage core application security tools and develop custom software to integrate with the development pipeline.
Primary job responsibilities include:
 Maintaining and expanding the enterprise vulnerability management system, ThreadFix Supporting technology expansion and upgrades Designing, developing, and testing custom software/scripts to integrate security, software development, and risk management systems Providing solutions to seamlessly integrate vulnerability management into modern software development tools and practices Ensuring tools and documentation are maintained in accordance with enterprise policies and best practices Providing expert, 3rd level support on technology issues Driving vendor accountability to address product defects Collaborating with Application Security Champions, development team members, and other Information Security teams as a product and vulnerability management SME Collaboration with an offshore development and product support team
Required Qualifications
5+ years of information security applications and systems experience
4+ years of information technology applications and systems experience
Desired Qualifications
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Other Desired Qualifications 5+ years of technology management experience (managing software upgrades, ensuring availability, etc.) 3+ years of software development or scripting experience (Java and/or Python preferred) 3+ years of application security experience 3+ years of SQL experience. T-SQL / MSSQL preferred. Experience with Agile and CI/CD technologies such as Jira, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, etc. Experience deploying applications on Kubernetes Able to troubleshoot complex technology integration issues
Job Expectations
Ability to travel up to 5% of the time
Street AddressMO-Saint Louis: 1 N Jefferson Ave - Saint Louis, MONC-Charlotte: 1525 W Wt Harris Blvd - Charlotte, NCNC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NCAZ-PHX-Northwest Phoenix: 2222 W Rose Garden Ln - Phoenix, AZMN-Minneapolis: 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MNMN-Shoreview: 1801 Parkview Dr - Shoreview, MNIA-Des Moines: 800 Walnut St - Des Moines, IATX-Irving: 2975 Regent Blvd - Irving, TXTX-Plano: 4975 Preston Park Blvd - Plano, TXCA-SF-Financial District: 333 Market St - San Francisco, CANC-Raleigh: 1100 Corporate Center Dr - Raleigh, NCPA-Philadelphia: 101 N Independence Mall E - Philadelphia, PA
Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
Benefits SummaryBenefits 
Visit [Link available when viewing the job] for benefits information. task_experience:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message.  In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application. 
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.
Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.
The Enterprise Application Security Program enhances the ability of the development organization to consistently deliver highly functional applications that are secure and resilient against attack. We develop the policies, processes, and tools to proactively embed security into Wells Fargo-developed applications. The person in this role is a key member of the Secure Software Group who will manage core application security tools and develop custom software to integrate with the development pipeline.
 Maintaining and expanding the enterprise vulnerability management system, ThreadFix Supporting technology expansion and upgrades Designing, developing, and testing custom software/scripts to integrate security, software development, and risk management systems Providing solutions to seamlessly integrate vulnerability management into modern software development tools and practices Ensuring tools and documentation are maintained in accordance with enterprise policies and best practices Providing expert, 3rd level support on technology issues Driving vendor accountability to address product defects Collaborating with Application Security Champions, development team members, and other Information Security teams as a product and vulnerability management SME Collaboration with an offshore development and product support team
Other Desired Qualifications 5+ years of technology management experience (managing software upgrades, ensuring availability, etc.) 3+ years of software development or scripting experience (Java and/or Python preferred) 3+ years of application security experience 3+ years of SQL experience. T-SQL / MSSQL preferred. Experience with Agile and CI/CD technologies such as Jira, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, etc. Experience deploying applications on Kubernetes Able to troubleshoot complex technology integration issues
Street AddressMO-Saint Louis: 1 N Jefferson Ave - Saint Louis, MONC-Charlotte: 1525 W Wt Harris Blvd - Charlotte, NCNC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NCAZ-PHX-Northwest Phoenix: 2222 W Rose Garden Ln - Phoenix, AZMN-Minneapolis: 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MNMN-Shoreview: 1801 Parkview Dr - Shoreview, MNIA-Des Moines: 800 Walnut St - Des Moines, IATX-Irving: 2975 Regent Blvd - Irving, TXTX-Plano: 4975 Preston Park Blvd - Plano, TXCA-SF-Financial District: 333 Market St - San Francisco, CANC-Raleigh: 1100 Corporate Center Dr - Raleigh, NCPA-Philadelphia: 101 N Independence Mall E - Philadelphia, PA
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

task_text:
Here at Boston Market, we are Far From Fries. Are you looking to feed your career, not just a time clock? We have a career path to fit your personal and professional growth goals. Crew Members will join our diverse and loyal team, working together to achieve great results, tackle challenges and have fun along the way. A career at Boston Market means more: it means flexible hours, wholesome food, friendships that last and customer service we can be proud of every day.
We have jobs available for all part-time hourly positions including: Servers, Cashiers, Carvers, Cooks, Drive Thru and more. 
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
o  Discounted meals while you're on the clock
o  Corporate Discount Programs
o  Daily Pay Opportunities
o  Medical, dental, vision insurance (eligible after one-year anniversary)
o  College Partnerships
o  We actively engage in philanthropic endeavors including our work for Give Kids the World Village
Previous restaurant experience is helpful, but not necessary. We'll train you to prepare, serve or deliver home-style meals the Boston Market way.
Boston Market Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or veteran status. task_text:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a ServiceNow HR Analyst in Juno Beach, FL. Overview: We are looking for a ServiceNow HR Analyst that is passionate about employee experience. This position is responsible for conceptualizing and creating user interfaces and experiences that are engaging, accessible and functional across the company's HR Technology platforms. The ServiceNow HR Analyst is expected to think and act in ways that put our employees first, give seamless digital options at every touchpoint and make employees promoters of our products and services. Individuals will work cross functionally and collaboratively with Product Owners to consult, design. and develop experience solutions. The ServiceNow HR Analyst will also help drive user adoption and business enablement through instructional design development.
REQUIREMENTS:
 3+ years of relevant experience  Requirements include a solid understanding of preferred standards and practices  Proficient with HTML/CSS and jQuery  Experience with WalkMe and ServiceNow preferred 
 Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. task_text:
Allen County Office   
This position will be fully remote. Work from the comfort of your own home, while serving your community at the same time! The individual in this position must be licensed (LCSW, LMFT, LCAC, LMHC) or have their Associate License and reside in Indiana.
 The person in this position will work remotely with patients to diagnose and treat mental health and substance use disorders. This includes creating individual treatment plans according to patient needs and circumstances and meeting with patients remotely to provide counseling services while conducting ongoing assessments to ensure quality services are being provided and patient is progressing toward their goals.  Assess patients and diagnose mental health and/or substance use disorders. Create a treatment plan for patients based on the needs of the individual. Refer patient to other healthcare professionals if necessary. Work with family members, as needed, as part of treatment for the patient. Work with any clients in crisis situations, evaluate risk and initiate appropriate response to promote client safety. Complete CSSRS or other crisis tools and link to or provide necessary services that may include, but are not limited to, IPU admission, crisis planning, referral. Complete mental health and substance use evaluations for IPU discharged clients, high risk clients, critical care clients, and clients referred from psychiatric inpatient facilities outside Bowen Center, and other clients as needed and link them to necessary services    --> As an agency that works with a vulnerable demographic of individuals, we require extensive pre-employment background checks that aide in fulfilling our mission to protect our patients, keeping them safe from abuse and harm, by hiring quality and trustworthy staff.   60,000 - 62,000/year
 Education:  MSW, MS, MA, Ph,D., Psy,D. Certificate or Professional License: Health Service Provider in Psychology (HSPP); Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW); Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT); Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC) required. (Associates License is also accepted).    
Pay: 60,000-62,000/year Allen County Office

Complete mental health and substance use evaluations for IPU discharged clients, high risk clients, critical care clients, and clients referred from psychiatric inpatient facilities outside Bowen Center, and other clients as needed and link them to necessary services Assess patients and diagnose mental health and/or substance use disorders. Create a treatment plan for patients based on the needs of the individual. Refer patient to other healthcare professionals if necessary. Work with family members, as needed, as part of treatment for the patient. Work with any clients in crisis situations, evaluate risk and initiate appropriate response to promote client safety. Complete CSSRS or other crisis tools and link to or provide necessary services that may include, but are not limited to, IPU admission, crisis planning, referral. Complete mental health and substance use evaluations for IPU discharged clients, high risk clients, critical care clients, and clients referred from psychiatric inpatient facilities outside Bowen Center, and other clients as needed and link them to necessary services 
 Pay: 60,000-62,000/year

Senior Java DeveloperBCforward is currently seeking highly motivated Senior Java developer in Irving, TX with direct client  We place consultants for end clients all over USA.Irving, TX Looking for a Backend Core Java Developer with strong skills in MQ's and services.MUST have strength in Java 8+Looking for a minimum of 6+ years in application developmentNOT looking for UI developers or Fullstack developers The Applications Development Senior Programmer Analyst is an intermediate level position responsible for participation in the establishment and implementation of new or revised application systems and programs in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to applications systems analysis and programming activities. Responsibilities:* Conduct tasks related to feasibility studies, time and cost estimates, IT planning, risk technology, applications development, model development, and establish and implement new or revised applications systems and programs to meet specific business needs or user areas* Monitor and control all phases of development process and analysis, design, construction, testing, and implementation as well as provide user and operational support on applications to business users* Utilize in-depth specialty knowledge of applications development to analyze complex problems/issues, provide evaluation of business process, system process, and industry standards, and make evaluative judgement* Recommend and develop security measures in post implementation analysis of business usage to ensure successful system design and functionality* Consult with users/clients and other technology groups on issues, recommend advanced programming solutions, and install and assist customer exposure systems* Ensure essential procedures are followed and help define operating standards and processes* Serve as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts* Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.* Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.* Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.* Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding clientgroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.* A hands on Tech lead, responsible for implementing enterprise scale solutions.* Deliver high quality technical solutions to multiple global stakeholders in a fast paced environment* Manage multiple tasks and dependencies effectively in order to deliver quality, on-time solutions Qualifications:* 5-8 years of software development experience* Expert knowledge of Core Java 8, J2EE, Spring, Spring Batch, Hibernate, Spring MVC, RESTful Web services, Workflows* Strong computer science fundamentals in data structures, algorithms, databases, O/S.* Experience developing high-performance multi-threaded applications* Thorough understanding of server side integration, Restful, Spring MVC, web services, workflows* Good knowledge of design patterns and providing solutions to complex design issues* Good skills in web servers such as WebSphere, Tomcat* Provide architectural solutions to Internal Audit platform needs* Experience with source code management tools such as SVN, Git/Bitbucket* Experience in Cloud Technologies* Hands on experience in Servlets, JSP, Spring, Hibernate, WebSphere /Tomcat, JS/TS* Should have good exposure to Oracle (SQL, PL/SQL),* Knowledge or experience in Big data technologies and frameworks is an added advantage.* Hands-on experience with designing and developing world class technology solutions. Be comfortable introducing new technologies and new ideas as required.* Experience in systems analysis and programming of software applications* Experience in managing and implementing successful projects* Working knowledge of consulting/project management techniques/methods* Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines or unexpected changes in expectations or requirements Education:* Bachelors degree/University degree or equivalent experience Position ContactAbout BCforward:BCforward began as an IT business solution and staffing firm. Founded in 1998, BCforward has grown with our customers' needs into a full-service personnel solution's organization. Headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, BCforward also operates numerous delivery centers across North America and India. We are currently the largest consulting firm and largest MBE certified firm in Indiana. Our uninterrupted growth has allowed BCforward to deliver uniquely configured IT staffing and project solutions for over the years of catering to our customers' specific needs. BCforward currently maintains a team of over 5000 global resources. With our additional brand, Stafforward, together we have the capabilities to deliver services for a variety of industries in both public and private sectors which allows us to address your most challenging needs. www.BCforward.com www.facebook.com/bcforward"We must inform you that during the hiring process, we may ask for you to disclose and provide us with various categories of your personal information, including identifiers such as your name and address, professional information, commercial information, education information, and other related information. Job Description Description: 
0-2 Years of Experience. Provides data entry support for the HR Shared Services (HRSS) center or for other HR departments. Maintains data in HR applications including employee records and HR program information. Monitors interface between various applications including HRIS, performance management tool, recruitment tool, corporate directory, etc. Performs ongoing data audits for accuracy and compliance and resolves discrepancies. Generates HR reports. Will be performing manual data entry, check daily data error logs, validate data by comparing data sets in Excel. Must have ability to think critically, word under strict deadlines, and have attention to detail. Some Workday or Oracle experience preferred but not required. Excel experience required. 
Will be remote until further notice. 6 months contract only, maybe potential to convert. HV laptop provided. 30 minute interview with HM. Willing to look at non-local candidates. 
Former Req 10695-1

task_title: State Tested Nursing Aide, STNA - Facility Staffing
task_text:
Working at [Link available when viewing the job] means a career unlike any other. With integrity at the center of all we do, we know that when we support you and your community, you’ll change lives every day.
Our State Tested Nursing Aide (STNAs) have been called to care when they’re needed most. As a member of our staffing team, you’ll support a full range of patient services to bring comfort and dignity to our clients. 
What you’ll do: 
Teach patient essential self-care skills, as needed. 
Help the patient navigate the healthcare system by scheduling appointments and communicating needs to our nursing team, when appropriate.  
Check patient’s vital signs and/or administer medication under a nurse’s direction.  
What we’re looking for: 
State Tested Nursing Aide (STNA) certification from the state associated with this position required. 
Attention to detail; able to carefully follow instructions and document notes regarding a patient’s condition. 
Reliable transportation to/from care sites and/or work location. 
A dependable approach to work and an engaging, encouraging, empathetic, and compassionate attitude. 
What we offer: 
Competitive compensation, benefits, and incentives. 
Truly flexible scheduling – a dedication to work/life balance. 
A team environment with a focus on community service. 
At Interim HealthCare Facility Staffing, we know that vacancies and last minute call-offs don’t just impact revenue, they’re a matter of patient safety - that’s why our network of healthcare facilities and clients trust us with their openings. From support staff and MAs to Nurses and Therapists, we match talent with flexible opportunities in a variety of practice settings. We see staffing as a strategy for stress relief.

Our State Tested Nursing Aide (STNAs) have been called to care when they’re needed most. As a member of our staffing team, you’ll support a full range of patient services to bring comfort and dignity to our clients. 
What you’ll do: 
Teach patient essential self-care skills, as needed. 
Help the patient navigate the healthcare system by scheduling appointments and communicating needs to our nursing team, when appropriate.  
Check patient’s vital signs and/or administer medication under a nurse’s direction.  
What we’re looking for: 
State Tested Nursing Aide (STNA) certification from the state associated with this position required. 
Attention to detail; able to carefully follow instructions and document notes regarding a patient’s condition. 
Reliable transportation to/from care sites and/or work location. 
A dependable approach to work and an engaging, encouraging, empathetic, and compassionate attitude. 
What we offer: 
Competitive compensation, benefits, and incentives. 
Truly flexible scheduling – a dedication to work/life balance. 
A team environment with a focus on community service. 
At Interim HealthCare Facility Staffing, we know that vacancies and last minute call-offs don’t just impact revenue, they’re a matter of patient safety - that’s why our network of healthcare facilities and clients trust us with their openings. From support staff and MAs to Nurses and Therapists, we match talent with flexible opportunities in a variety of practice settings. We see staffing as a strategy for stress relief.
#Newark2

task_text:
Turtle & Hughes is an electrical and industrial distribution company with about 900 employees. Our primary business is supplying and servicing utilities, electrical contractors, construction managers, and end-users. We strive to provide the industry’s most comprehensive range of services and solutions. This is how we have earned our ranking among the nation’s largest independent electrical and industrial distributors.Turtle & Hughes is recruiting for a Corporate Operations Assistant in Linden, NJ.  The Corporate Operations Assistant is responsible for company-wide daily reporting, memo account reconciliation, order corrections, site visits, and projects as assigned.
This position will be a hybrid position, meaning on-site, field-based, and remote as the schedule permits.  While remote, a viable work space must be available free of distractions.  
Essential Functions:  
Daily Reporting
Branch Reviews
Order Corrections
 
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Excel
Outlook
Ability to work independently
Excellent communication skills
Detail oriented with focus on quality and accuracy.  Attention to detail is a must.
Works well under pressure in fast-paced environment with multiple, sometimes shifting priorities. 
Confident, reliable, and personable team player.  Must be able to work with all levels throughout the company.
Ability to travel up to 20% of time, as required.
We offer a competitive benefits package that includes a 401(k) plan, health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, paid holidays, vacation and a host of additional employee negotiated discounts.Turtle and Hughes is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workforce. task_text:
At Border Foods, our purpose is to Make Lives Better and it is at the foundation of all that we do. We are proud of our family culture that develops people and provides career growth in pristine restaurants where people aspire to work, guests desire to dine… where Live Más comes to life.
As the General Manager, you are responsible for the operation of the entire restaurant and building a strong team that consistently provides customers great food and a friendly experience. 
General Manager Responsibilities
Oversee team members and Shift Managers and ensure they complete all assigned duties and serve safe, quality food in a friendly manner
Finding, hiring, and developing excellent Team Members and Shift Managers
Conducting New Hire orientation and developing the training plan for each new hire
Scheduling and deploying the Team correctly, addressing performance issues and managing the restaurant budget and financial plans
Ensure that the restaurant is a safe place for team members to work and customers to visit
Make sure health and safety standards are met
Priority Sequence
Safety
Service
Cleaning
Stocking
What's in it for you?
Top pay in the industry
Trip to Mexico! Every year, we reward our top performers on our Best of the Best trip to Mexico. In 2020, we'll be taking 85 General Managers!
Bonus program! Supplement your base salary with huge bonus capabilities!
Education programs, including GED and Tuition Reimbursement offerings 
Scholarship opportunities
Medical/Dental/Vision benefits offered for all positions – even part-time!
Free food!
Vacation Time (Paid Time Off), Sick, and Holiday Pay
Vacation Donation Program
Border Family Cares Program
Border Smiles Program
An incredible culture that encourages career growth and support

task_text:
Director, Data Engineering - Permanent - Remote - $190k
The Director, Data Engineering will be leading multiple teams of Data Engineers building the next generation of data models and systems for this company's product catalog and analytics platforms in the Azure Cloud. This position will set the architectural standard for the workgroup, as well as providing the team with day-to-day management and direction to accomplish on-time, efficient delivery of product development goals. Using cutting edge tools like Databricks and Stardog, you and your teams will be architecting relational and graph data models, as well as developing queries, transformations, and pipelines required for their internal and external clients to retrieve, analyze, predict, and report insights from their immense amount of data. This position will provide strategic leadership for all data systems and teams in their domain, working as closely with stakeholders in product management, data science, data engineering, and analyst teams as they do with their own organization. 
About You You're a passionate, dynamic, and highly motivated strategic thought leader who's looking for an opportunity to have an impact on some of the most well-known companies in the world. If you enjoy working with best-in-class data and helping clients make transformative business decisions, this job is for you.  
Responsibilities:
Make strategic decisions around data architecture, organizational shape, and personnel planning.
Drive the development of highly scalable, secure, and flexible cloud-based data warehouses and models, supporting big data and business intelligence platforms.
Collaborate with stakeholders to develop, maintain, and evangelize data strategies.
Ensure all staff is provided with frequent feedback, coaching, training and resources in order to meet and exceed individual and team performance goals consistently.
Lead the development of technical standards and perform reviews to ensure enterprise and architectural standards and processes are followed.
Lead initiatives from design through implementation and delivery.
Proactively engage in continuous improvement of processes and capabilities to take advantage of new technology offerings.
Assist in budgeting activities.
Manage and encourage new ideas from staff to foster improvements through innovations.
Empower the staff to be accountable and responsible for their own actions and decisions.
Requirements
12+ years of Data Engineering experience.
5+ years of Data Engineering people management and project management experience.
3+ years' experience with big data in a cloud first environment, with Azure preferred.
Ability to translate strategic objectives into action plans, ensuring team is focused on strategic priorities, as well as near-term operational priorities.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and client service skills. Effective interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills applicable to a wide audience including senior/executive management, clients, and peers.
Capable of forecasting needs and ensuring effective and efficient management of time and resources.
Understands the evolving landscape of technology and its effect on customers and data products.
Skilled in creating a climate in which people want to do their best; can motivate many kinds of direct reports and team or project members.
Ability to adapt quickly to utilize best practices.
BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required; advanced degree preferred
Technical Skills
Expertise in multiple databases technologies, such as relational (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres, MariaDB), Graph (Gremlin, sparql, shacl), big data (Databricks, Hadoop/HBase), and Search (Elastic, SOLAR).
Advanced data modeling skills.
Development experience with strong proficiency using Python, R or Scala, with Databricks preferred.
Strong Proficiency with data manipulation languages such as SQL, Sparql, Spark, DAX and SAS.
Advanced Experience with Azure PAAS cloud technologies at the enterprise level for data and analytics.
If this role seems like a good fit for you, please reach out to Shannon today at [Email available when viewing the job].
*12+ years of Data Engineering experience. •5+ years of Data Engineering people management and project management experience. •3+ years' experience with big data in a cloud first environment, with Azure preferred. •Ability to translate strategic objectives into action plans, ensuring team is focused on strategic priorities, as well as near-term operational priorities. •Excellent communication (verbal and written) and client service skills. Effective interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills applicable to a wide audience including senior/executive management, clients, and peers. •Capable of forecasting needs and ensuring effective and efficient management of time and resources. •Understands the evolving landscape of technology and its effect on customers and data products. •Skilled in creating a climate in which people want to do their best; can motivate many kinds of direct reports and team or project members. •Ability to adapt quickly to utilize best practices. •BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required; advanced degree preferred Technical Skills •Expertise in multiple databases technologies, such as relational (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres, MariaDB), Graph (Gremlin, sparql, shacl), big data (Databricks, Hadoop/HBase), and Search (Elastic, SOLAR). •Advanced data modeling skills. •Development experience with strong proficiency using Python, R or Scala, with Databricks preferred. •Strong Proficiency with data manipulation languages such as SQL, Sparql, Spark, DAX and SAS. •Advanced Experience with Azure PAAS cloud technologies at the enterprise level for data and analytics. Using cutting edge tools like Databricks and Stardog, you and your teams will be architecting relational and graph data models, as well as developing queries, transformations, and pipelines required for their internal and external clients to retrieve, analyze, predict, and report insights from their immense amount of data. This position will provide strategic leadership for all data systems and teams in their domain, working as closely with stakeholders in product management, data science, data engineering, and analyst teams as they do with their own organization. 
About You You're a passionate, dynamic, and highly motivated strategic thought leader who's looking for an opportunity to have an impact on some of the most well-known companies in the world. If you enjoy working with best-in-class data and helping clients make transformative business decisions, this job is for you.  
Responsibilities:
Make strategic decisions around data architecture, organizational shape, and personnel planning.
Drive the development of highly scalable, secure, and flexible cloud-based data warehouses and models, supporting big data and business intelligence platforms.
Collaborate with stakeholders to develop, maintain, and evangelize data strategies.
Ensure all staff is provided with frequent feedback, coaching, training and resources in order to meet and exceed individual and team performance goals consistently.
Lead the development of technical standards and perform reviews to ensure enterprise and architectural standards and processes are followed.
Lead initiatives from design through implementation and delivery.
Proactively engage in continuous improvement of processes and capabilities to take advantage of new technology offerings.
Assist in budgeting activities.
Manage and encourage new ideas from staff to foster improvements through innovations.
Empower the staff to be accountable and responsible for their own actions and decisions.
Requirements
12+ years of Data Engineering experience.
5+ years of Data Engineering people management and project management experience.
3+ years' experience with big data in a cloud first environment, with Azure preferred.
Ability to translate strategic objectives into action plans, ensuring team is focused on strategic priorities, as well as near-term operational priorities.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and client service skills. Effective interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills applicable to a wide audience including senior/executive management, clients, and peers.
Capable of forecasting needs and ensuring effective and efficient management of time and resources.
Understands the evolving landscape of technology and its effect on customers and data products.
Skilled in creating a climate in which people want to do their best; can motivate many kinds of direct reports and team or project members.
Ability to adapt quickly to utilize best practices.
BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required; advanced degree preferred
Technical Skills
Expertise in multiple databases technologies, such as relational (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres, MariaDB), Graph (Gremlin, sparql, shacl), big data (Databricks, Hadoop/HBase), and Search (Elastic, SOLAR).
Advanced data modeling skills.
Development experience with strong proficiency using Python, R or Scala, with Databricks preferred.
Strong Proficiency with data manipulation languages such as SQL, Sparql, Spark, DAX and SAS.
Advanced Experience with Azure PAAS cloud technologies at the enterprise level for data and analytics.
If this role seems like a good fit for you, please reach out to Shannon today at [Email available when viewing the job].
