task_text:
Ledgent Technology is seeking a Front-End Web Developer to develop, launch and maintain websites and marketing systems for a growing client base.This is a full-time, direct hire opportunity with ample room for technical and career growth.This position is 100% on-site in West Palm Beach, Florida.Hours: Monday - Friday // 9:00AM - 6:00PMWhat you should bring to the table / What you will be doing: 
Comprehensive understanding of WordPress - 5+ years required
MODX PHP development experience strongly preferred
Strong hands-on experience with front-end, responsive technologies including HTML5, CSS3 (Flexbox and Grid preferred)/SASS, JavaScript, jQuery
Bootstrap 4 experience
Experience with Node Package Manager (NPM)
Command Line Interface understanding
Cross-browser testing experience
Website Speed Optimization experience
Thorough understanding of the DRY* principal of SW development
Proficiency in PHP and Webpack preferrable
Ability and experience collaborating with a team of developers
Experience building WordPress websites
Experience working with GIT Source Control
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools like GIT
Experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications
Experience designing and developing responsive design websites
Ability to convert comprehensive layout and wireframes into working HTML pages
Multiple CMS experience preferred (WordPress, MODX, Drupal etc.)
Experience migrating websites cross-platform is preferred
Experience working with images and video in large file formats
We are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. Website Speed Optimization experience
Thorough understanding of the DRY* principal of SW development
Proficiency in PHP and Webpack preferrable
Ability and experience collaborating with a team of developers
Experience working with GIT Source Control
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools like GIT
Experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications
Experience designing and developing responsive design websites
Ability to convert comprehensive layout and wireframes into working HTML pages
Multiple CMS experience preferred (WordPress, MODX, Drupal etc.)

task_text:
Position Description: Fostered in over 178 years of history and expansion, Joseph T. Ryerson & Son, Inc. continues paving the way for ingenuity and innovation as one of North America’s largest metal distributers.  Ryerson provides high quality, essential products that our customers rely on, while creating teams of individuals who are ambitious and hard-working.  We are always looking for talented and motivated individuals because we understand that our people are our most valuable asset. We believe in promoting from within and providing the resources for long-term career progression and development.   If you are interested in working for an essential business with a global reach that is dedicated to a great work atmosphere, and a say yes attitude, Ryerson is looking for you!Currently, Ryerson’s Milwaukee, WI plant has an opportunity for a 2nd shift Order Assembler. Candidate will be expected to learn;• Product banding• Forklift operation• Mobile equipment• Order assembly   
 
 Position Requirements: • HS diploma or GED required • Regular attendance • Ability to work independently and within a team • Positive attitude and willingness to learn• Adheres to Ryerson safety protocol • Basic math skills• Basic computer skills• 1-3 years of experience   We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, and pregnancy), age, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, marital status, status as a veteran, or any other federal, state or local protected class or artificial barrier. task_text:
Maximus is currently seeking a  .Net Developer to work remotely to focus on the development of  a Medicaid Provider Data Management System.   The position  r  esponsible for the development and finalization of all technical system documentation in relation to the data management system.   
 
  Primary Responsibilities:  
  Focus on development of a Medicaid Provider Data Management System working directly with other Sr.NET developers, business analysts and testers   Maintain and modify software programs and perform software design and development, unit testing, and debugging of software code   Defect correction   Design, develop and test software components, and document and diagram application functionality from business requirements   Participate in design and code reviews   Develop custom adapters allowing the integration of legacy (i.e., capabilities not developed as services) capabilities with service-based Framework infrastructure and services   Primary point of contact for assigned technical deliverables   Ensure development activities are aligned with scope, schedule, priority and business objectives   Meet or exceed all operational readiness requirements (e.g., operations engineering, performance)   Ensure all tasks and milestones associated with technical design, development and unit testing are completed according to project management guidelines   Ensure that product configurations and enhancements are made correctly and deployed per our release management plan   Responsible for the development and finalization of all technical system documentation  
Minimum Requirements:
 Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience Minimum of three (3) to four (4) years Software Development in a Product based organization Experience working in a collaborative team environment Experience with Object Oriented Programming Experience with Database Design and Implementation Understanding of n-tier Application Architecture (e.g. MVC, SOA) and Design Patterns .NET certification preferred Basic understanding of AWS Core services preferred Experience designing and implementing .Net solutions with a focus on SOA, messaging, and business rules Working knowledge of web services, service discovery protocol, messaging protocols (REST, RPC, WS-*, SOAP etc.), and schema design Experience developing solutions integrating and extending COTS products Experience with performance tuning and optimization of service-based Framework infrastructure and services Experience working with State government clients in the Medicaid systems domain preferred Excellent organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Strong analysis, problem identification, and problem resolution capability Deadline-oriented and comfortably perform in a fast-paced environment Ability to successfully manage many complex tasks simultaneously Maximus is currently seeking a  .Net Developer to work remotely to focus on the development of  a Medicaid Provider Data Management System. task_title: Sr Software Engineer - Telecommute in Phoenix, AZ
task_text:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
To know more about Optum Technology,[Link available when viewing the job]
If you are located in Phoenix, AZ, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:  
 Anticipates customer needs and proactively develops solutions to meet them Serves as a key resource to solve complex problems and develop innovative approaches and solutions Performs complex conceptual analyses Sought out as a technical expert /SME, and helps mentor others Performs and participates in other required design reviews (e.g., peer reviews, business/partner reviews, Voice of the Customer) Adheres to applicable enterprise development methodologies and processes (e.g., Scrum, Agile, Waterfall, Iterative, and EPMO) Helps define / prioritize product delivery cycles Performs risk assessments with mitigation plans to ensure continuity/consistency/compatibility with existing solutions, and communicates to appropriate business and IT stakeholders Documents technical product features/designs and submits for review/approval by applicable stakeholders (e.g., architecture committee/council) Ensure that technical specifications/design documents are clearly and comprehensively documented, understood and traceable to the application / system design (e.g., traceability matrix) Account for applicable security requirements in technical specifications/design documents Optimizes user experience, especially where system interfaces directly with users Ensure optimal application configurability and automation to support multiple business models and technical platforms Ensure compliance with applicable code standards and architectures Reviews, troubleshoots, and remediates potential coding issues Creates, documents, and executes appropriate unit test plans, and documents results to ensure that code works as designed Ensures that product / software code is clearly and comprehensively developed and traceable back to technical specifications (e.g. traceability matrix) Provide or support development of release documentation to applicable groups (e.g., release notes, change requests) Demonstrate clear understanding of how the product/software may be impacted in all aspects of the testing process (e.g. regression testing, integration testing) Analyze/fix defects identified in testing (e.g., root cause analysis) Partner with applicable groups (e.g., QA) to develop, review and/or provide feedback on testing scenarios Identify scenarios that may require regression and/or integration testing, and communicate to appropriate testing groups (e.g., QA) Execute and/or support all required testing (e.g., performance, integration, volume) Work with Infrastructure Services to resolve issues identified in specific testing environments Support and/or coordinate integration testing with associated applications and systems, as needed Ensures that the deployment process is compliant with all operational requirements for the product/software Ensures appropriate deployment of code objects to production environments, and follows-up on first run (functional and technical performance) Helps review the work of others in collaborative/ quality mindset, and provides appropriate feedback (e.g., code coverage, code reviews, test plan reviews), as applicable Coordinates with both onshore and offshore teams as needed Flexible and Able to wear multiple hats within agile scrum team
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
 6+ years demonstrated proficiency in Java, Struts, Spring Boot, Open Shift or Kubernetes 3+ years demonstrated proficiency in Oracle 11 (or higher) 1+ years demonstrated proficiency in Jenkins, Cucumber, Tivoli Work Station (TWS), Subversion / GIT, CA Agile Central or Jira Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance
Preferred Qualifications:
 Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience Experience with Facets v4.74 (or higher) Programming experience working in .NET Experience working with ETL tools like Data Stage 8.7 (or higher) or Talend WTX 8.4 (or higher) Experience working with IBM TSO Mainframe Experience working with Unix / Linux HP Application Lifecycle Management (HP ALM)
To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies now require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles require full COVID-19 vaccination as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.
Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
Job Keywords: Sr Software Engineer, Senior Software Engineer, Software Engineer, Software Engineering, Phoenix, AZ, Arizona, Telecommute, Telecommuting, Telecommuter, Work From Home, Work At Home, Remote Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

task_text:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message.  In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application. 
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Wealth & Investment Management, or WIM, is one of the United States’ leading providers of financial and investment services. WIM provides a full range of personalized wealth management, investment, and retirement products and services to meet clients’ unique needs and help them achieve financial goals. Our mission is to help clients pursue their financial goals with confidence. We accomplish this by:
 Building enduring client relationships through sound, thoughtful, and objective advice Developing individualized plans for clients to help meet their financial objectives Helping clients build, manage, preserve, and transition their financial resources and wealth
WIM serves clients through the following businesses:
 Wells Fargo Private Bank serves high-net-worth individuals and families. Wells Fargo Advisors provides investment advice and guidance to clients through more than 13,200 full-service financial advisors and referrals from more than 5,450 licensed bankers.  Wells Fargo Asset Management brings together a strategic balance of investment capabilities to serve the investment needs of institutions, financial advisors, and individuals worldwide.
Through Wells Fargo Private Bank, WIM is also a leading provider of trust, investment, and fiduciary services, including personal trust services and a number of specialized wealth services designed to meet the diverse needs of high-net-worth clients.
Reporting to the Head of Intranet and Digital Experience for Wealth & Investment Management (WIM), this position will focus on providing intranet service and support to the WIM businesses and play a primary role in leading business testing for digital solutions.  He / she will be key to the digital success of our WIM businesses and responsible for end-to-end support across all aspects, including daily request queue management, site design and build, business needs assessment, research and analysis, common and custom solutions delivery, and support related consultation.  
Specific responsibilities include:
 Monitor request queues and provide responses to business partners or route issues for appropriate resolution Track to team and individual key performance indicators, metrics, and data points and provide analysis when necessary Evaluate everyday support and provide recommendations on ways to improve processes, including the ways emerging digital tools can be effective Deliver new sites or solutions in alignment with digital and product strategies, processes, and procedures, including the WIM intranet site build and configuration process Provide training and consultation to business partners in order to help them be successful in managing sites and content Manage or maintain digital solutions and intranet utilities i.e. navigation, search or web templates Lead or participate in process development, supporting materials documentation, and the delivery of reporting Provide end-to-end management of business testing, including test strategies, test cases, scripts, reporting and managing the test plan to timely completion with business partners Elicit business needs from partners and ensure the accurate translation of those needs into documented business requirements Perform information gathering, research and analysis using a variety of techniques in order to help establish or evolve strategies, better understand users or processes, and resolve business problems  Contribute to projects, complex initiatives and/or digital implementations 
Depending on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date.  
Required Qualifications
3+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: digital customer experience, digital product/program management, digital platforms, or digital consulting demonstrated through work or military experience
Desired Qualifications
Ability to identify trends and recommend product enhancements
4+ years of SharePoint experience
3+ years of experience supporting technology in a regulated environment
Strong analytical skills and ability to build business cases
Ability to translate business needs into complex analysis, designs and recommendations. Uses analysis to identify and define business requirements, while supporting the validity of the final product.
Ability to analyze business requirements and transform those requirements into business rules
Ability to identify key issues, involve affected parties, design solutions, obtain buy-in, and communicate effectively through resolution
JIRA experience
Experience with Agile methodology of project delivery
Other Desired Qualifications A BS/BA degree or higher Experience with content strategy, information architecture and web usability concepts Experience building and managing sites using Microsoft SharePoint versions 2016 and Office 365 Experience using HTML and high-level understanding of CSS Experience with defining and documenting business requirements using waterfall and agile methodologies Experience with developing and documenting test cases and scripts using waterfall and agile methodologies Experience developing and delivering training and support to end-users and business partners
Job Expectations
Ability to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays as needed or scheduled
Salary InformationThe salary range displayed below is based on a Full-time 40 hour a week schedule.MO-Saint Louis:  Min: $71,000 Mid: $100,000 Max: $129,000MN-Minneapolis:  Min: $71,000 Mid: $100,000 Max: $129,000NC-Charlotte:  Min: $71,000 Mid: $100,000 Max: $129,000
Street AddressMO-Saint Louis: 1 N Jefferson Ave - Saint Louis, MOMN-Minneapolis: 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MNNC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NC
Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
Benefits SummaryBenefits 
Visit [Link available when viewing the job] for benefits information. 3+ years of experience supporting technology in a regulated environment

Ability to analyze business requirements and transform those requirements into business rules
Ability to identify key issues, involve affected parties, design solutions, obtain buy-in, and communicate effectively through resolution
 Ability to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays as needed or scheduled Ability to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays as needed or scheduled   Salary Information

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Java J2EE in Columbus, OH. Can you picture yourself working for one of -America's Ideal Employers-? Our client has received numerous awards and accolades due in part to their commitment to diversity, veterans, and fostering innovation. They've been named one of Fortune Magazine's -World's Most Admired Companies- of 2018 and are included in the -Top 50 Most Innovative Companies- named by Boston Consulting Group. With on-site training and mentoring, they are committed to your professional development as well.
REQUIREMENTS:
 Expert in Java J2EE and design technique as well as experience working across large environments with multiple operating systems/infrastructures for large-scale programs (e.g., Expert Engineers) starting to be firm-wide resources working on projects across the company  Is multi-skilled with expertise across software development lifecycle and toolset  May be recognized as a leader in Agile and cultivating teams working in Agile frameworks  Sought out as coach for at least one technical skill  Strong understanding of techniques such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development, Cloud Development, resiliency, security  Stays abreast of cutting-edge technologies/trends and uses experience to influence application of those technologies/trends to support the business; May give speeches and outside the firm, writes articles  Senior experience needed for Microservice/API development with some Python and SQL to help guide development 
 Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. task_text:
L3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers’ mission and quest for professional growth. L3Harris provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do. 
L3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers’ mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across air, land, sea, space and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $18 billion in annual revenue and 48,000 employees, with customers in more than 100 countries.   Description: 
Job Title: Sr. SpecialistSystems Engineer - RMA Analysis
Job Code: AS20211404-59770
Job Location: Anaheim, CA
Job Description:
Join us for an exciting opportunity at L3Harris in Anaheim, CA. As a Systems Engineering Specialty GPS Engineer, you will be responsible for the Safety, Reliability, Maintainability, Availability analysis, development, design, requirements, maturation, maintenance, and verification and validation over the program lifecycle. The products operate in military embedded real-time systems and can be used in weapons, ground, airborne, maritime, and space environments.
Essential Functions:
Will plan and contribute to providing innovative Systems Engineering solutions in Safety, Reliability, Maintainability, Availability activities consistent with business development plans.
Will contribute to execution of design, build, integration and test activities, problem resolution and verifying that the deliverable products meet all program and customer requirements.
Will provide project management reports as required, support senior level reviews as necessary.
Will provide inputs and reviews of the engineering technical baseline as part of proposal efforts.
The engineer will interface with the program’s leadership and other teams (SW and HW) on a frequent basis, conduct or participate in customer and/or program technical review presentations, and provide progress status updates on work products.
The engineer will participate in the product development process including design reviews.
Ability to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance.
Demonstrated experience with System Safety Assessment, Functional Hazard Analysis, and Software Safety Risk Assessment.
Knowledge with failure reporting and corrective action system (FRACAS).
Knowledge with basic circuit design, circuit schematic, built-in test design, parts derating guideline and circuit card assembly process.
Qualifications:
Position requires a Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering or other Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM) related discipline
4 years of prior relevant experience
Experience with Reliability, Maintainability and System Safety Program Plans and related MIL standards.
Experience with system reliability and maintainability analyses such as reliability modeling, prediction, and FMECA.
Experience with reliability prediction handbook MIL-HDBK-217F and reliability software tool such as Relex or PTC. 
Preferred Qualifications:
Candidates with experience in GPS equipment, ASICs, and FPGAs a plus.
Must work effectively in both independent and team environments.
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills.
   
Please be aware many of our positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. 
By submitting your résumé for this position, you understand and agree that L3Harris Technologies may share your résumé, as well as any other related personal information or documentation you provide, with its subsidiaries and affiliated companies for the purpose of considering you for other available positions.   
L3Harris Technologies is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. L3Harris is committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity and maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or other related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, characteristic or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local laws. L3Harris maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks, where permitted by law.   
L3Harris Technologies is an E-Verify Employer. Please click here for the E-Verify Poster in [Link available when viewing the job] or [Link available when viewing the job]. For information regarding your Right To Work, please click here for [Link available when viewing the job] or [Link available when viewing the job].   Analytical Collaborative Leader Problem Solver Strategic Technical  Quote  Flexible work schedule, paid overtime, cool technology, no micromanagement, nice campus, fun co-workers Systems Engineer

 Job Title:  
 Job Code: 
 Job Location: 
 Job Description: 
 
 Essential Functions: Will plan and contribute to providing innovative Systems Engineering solutions in Safety, Reliability, Maintainability, Availability activities consistent with business development plans.
Will contribute to execution of design, build, integration and test activities, problem resolution and verifying that the deliverable products meet all program and customer requirements.
Will provide project management reports as required, support senior level reviews as necessary.
Will provide inputs and reviews of the engineering technical baseline as part of proposal efforts.
The engineer will interface with the program’s leadership and other teams (SW and HW) on a frequent basis, conduct or participate in customer and/or program technical review presentations, and provide progress status updates on work products.
The engineer will participate in the product development process including design reviews.
Ability to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance.
Demonstrated experience with System Safety Assessment, Functional Hazard Analysis, and Software Safety Risk Assessment.
Knowledge with failure reporting and corrective action system (FRACAS).
Knowledge with basic circuit design, circuit schematic, built-in test design, parts derating guideline and circuit card assembly process. Will plan and contribute to providing innovative Systems Engineering solutions in Safety, Reliability, Maintainability, Availability activities consistent with business development plans. Will contribute to execution of design, build, integration and test activities, problem resolution and verifying that the deliverable products meet all program and customer requirements. Will provide project management reports as required, support senior level reviews as necessary. Will provide inputs and reviews of the engineering technical baseline as part of proposal efforts. The engineer will interface with the program’s leadership and other teams (SW and HW) on a frequent basis, conduct or participate in customer and/or program technical review presentations, and provide progress status updates on work products. The engineer will participate in the product development process including design reviews. Ability to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance. Demonstrated experience with System Safety Assessment, Functional Hazard Analysis, and Software Safety Risk Assessment. Knowledge with failure reporting and corrective action system (FRACAS). Knowledge with basic circuit design, circuit schematic, built-in test design, parts derating guideline and circuit card assembly process. 
 Qualifications: Position requires a Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering or other Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM) related discipline
4 years of prior relevant experience
Experience with Reliability, Maintainability and System Safety Program Plans and related MIL standards.
Experience with system reliability and maintainability analyses such as reliability modeling, prediction, and FMECA.
Experience with reliability prediction handbook MIL-HDBK-217F and reliability software tool such as Relex or PTC. Position requires a Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering or other Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM) related discipline 4 years of prior relevant experience Experience with Reliability, Maintainability and System Safety Program Plans and related MIL standards. Experience with system reliability and maintainability analyses such as reliability modeling, prediction, and FMECA. Experience with reliability prediction handbook MIL-HDBK-217F and reliability software tool such as Relex or PTC. 
 Preferred Qualifications: Candidates with experience in GPS equipment, ASICs, and FPGAs a plus.
Must work effectively in both independent and team environments.
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills. Candidates with experience in GPS equipment, ASICs, and FPGAs a plus. Must work effectively in both independent and team environments. Must have strong verbal and written communication skills. 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   Success Profile

task_experience:
L3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers’ mission and quest for professional growth. L3Harris provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do. 
L3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers’ mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across air, land, sea, space and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $18 billion in annual revenue and 48,000 employees, with customers in more than 100 countries.   Description: 
Job Title: Sr. SpecialistSystems Engineer - RMA Analysis
Job Code: AS20211404-59770
Job Location: Anaheim, CA
Join us for an exciting opportunity at L3Harris in Anaheim, CA. As a Systems Engineering Specialty GPS Engineer, you will be responsible for the Safety, Reliability, Maintainability, Availability analysis, development, design, requirements, maturation, maintenance, and verification and validation over the program lifecycle. The products operate in military embedded real-time systems and can be used in weapons, ground, airborne, maritime, and space environments.
Will plan and contribute to providing innovative Systems Engineering solutions in Safety, Reliability, Maintainability, Availability activities consistent with business development plans.
Will contribute to execution of design, build, integration and test activities, problem resolution and verifying that the deliverable products meet all program and customer requirements.
Will provide project management reports as required, support senior level reviews as necessary.
Will provide inputs and reviews of the engineering technical baseline as part of proposal efforts.
The engineer will interface with the program’s leadership and other teams (SW and HW) on a frequent basis, conduct or participate in customer and/or program technical review presentations, and provide progress status updates on work products.
The engineer will participate in the product development process including design reviews.
Ability to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance.
4 years of prior relevant experience
Experience with Reliability, Maintainability and System Safety Program Plans and related MIL standards.
Experience with reliability prediction handbook MIL-HDBK-217F and reliability software tool such as Relex or PTC. 
Must work effectively in both independent and team environments.
Please be aware many of our positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. 
By submitting your résumé for this position, you understand and agree that L3Harris Technologies may share your résumé, as well as any other related personal information or documentation you provide, with its subsidiaries and affiliated companies for the purpose of considering you for other available positions.   
L3Harris Technologies is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. L3Harris is committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity and maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or other related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, characteristic or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local laws. L3Harris maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks, where permitted by law.   
L3Harris Technologies is an E-Verify Employer. Please click here for the E-Verify Poster in [Link available when viewing the job] or [Link available when viewing the job]. For information regarding your Right To Work, please click here for [Link available when viewing the job] or [Link available when viewing the job]. Will contribute to execution of design, build, integration and test activities, problem resolution and verifying that the deliverable products meet all program and customer requirements. Will provide project management reports as required, support senior level reviews as necessary. Will provide inputs and reviews of the engineering technical baseline as part of proposal efforts. The engineer will interface with the program’s leadership and other teams (SW and HW) on a frequent basis, conduct or participate in customer and/or program technical review presentations, and provide progress status updates on work products. The engineer will participate in the product development process including design reviews. Ability to obtain a DoD SECRET clearance. Demonstrated experience with System Safety Assessment, Functional Hazard Analysis, and Software Safety Risk Assessment. Knowledge with failure reporting and corrective action system (FRACAS). Knowledge with basic circuit design, circuit schematic, built-in test design, parts derating guideline and circuit card assembly process. 
4 years of prior relevant experience
Experience with Reliability, Maintainability and System Safety Program Plans and related MIL standards.
Must work effectively in both independent and team environments.
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills. Candidates with experience in GPS equipment, ASICs, and FPGAs a plus. Must work effectively in both independent and team environments. Must have strong verbal and written communication skills.

task_text:
**Only U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. can be considered as W2 candidates.**Title: Device Management EngineerStart Date: 11/29/2021 End Date: 04/01/2023Location Atlanta GA 30313
Description:
In 2009, Client introduced the revolutionary Freestyle dispenser. It’s twelve years later and we’ve developed a completely new embedded system driving a new lineup of dispensers. We’re looking for passionate and experienced individuals to help the Freestyle fleet continue to be a best in class offering to our customers and consumers. Open the door of a Freestyle dispenser and you’ll find the latest cloud, web, IoT and embedded technologies directing an orchestra of motors, sensors, and precision pumps to create a virtually unlimited selection of beverages. If you’re inquisitive, ambitious, and excited by REST endpoints that open doors, run compressors and pump fluids then this may be the job for you!
Minimum Qualifications:
Computer Science degree, Computer Engineering degree, or three years of industry experience
Strong knowledge of IoT devices including knowledge in OS (Linux), at least one software language (Java preferred), and device management systems
Fluent in REST APIs, shell scripting, SQL, and basic computer networking
Experience working in a QA/testing environment and ticketing system (such as JIRA)
Experience working in production systems
Ability to triage problems, prioritize accordingly, and propose a resolution
Ability to analyze a dataset and communicate the results to a non-technical audience
Ability to work independently, raise issues and take corrective action
Detail oriented, analytical, and creative thinker with passion for embedded devices
Highly Preferred Qualifications:
Experience automating commands and API calls to achieve tasks on a remote embedded device
Strong working knowledge of unix command line tools
Programming experience in web based programming languages such as PHP
Working knowledge of common AWS services such as S3/Redshift/EC2/ECS/RDS/Etc
Knowledge of cellular networks with a focus on M2M devices
Responsibilities:
As a Device Management Engineer you will work directly with the device management team and fleet operations teams to monitor deployments to devices, troubleshoot issues with specific devices, identify issues that can be addressed remotely, and design and submit corrections to issues.
Monitor field devices for defects, recreate the defect in a test environment, and raise defects to development resources and vendors
Analyze dispenser logs to assist development resources in defect debugging
Support field escalation process and manage device defects from creation to resolution related to connectivity and device management
Provide support for field resources, when appropriate
Provide feedback on existing toolsets to drive improvements
Grow to be the subject matter expert of the embedded system and the dispenser functionality
Rose International is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender (expression or identity), national origin, arrest and conviction records, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Positions located in San Francisco and Los Angeles, California will be administered in accordance with their respective Fair Chance Ordinances. Rose International has an official agreement (ID #132522), effective June 30, 2008, with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Employment Verification Program (E-Verify). task_text:
Nucor is North America's largest recycler and most diversified steel and steel products company. Since 1969, we've led the industry in developing innovative technologies for recycling scrap into high-quality steels that are all around us, from bridges and buildings to cars and appliances.
Basic Job Functions:The Digital Specialist will work closely with the brand marketing team to develop new websites and optimize and enhance existing website and web-based tools. The Digital Specialist will help us accelerate growth, optimize campaign performance, and maximize budget efficiencies across SEO, SEM and PPC channels. They will also work to create and implement marketing automation campaigns to strengthen brand positioning and customer relationships using web tools. They will help promote brand identity and commercialization of products for a cohesive brand identity and messaging. They will collaborate with various groups to provide their expertise in evaluating new tools and technologies to establish and maintain our position as the industry leaders. Safety is the most important part of all jobs within Nucor; therefore, candidates must be able to demonstrate the ability to initiate, lead, and uphold safety policies, practices, procedures, and housekeeping standards at all times.
Minimum Qualifications: A minimum of 2-4 years of related experience. Willingness and ability to travel occasionally. 
Preferred Qualifications: Degree and/or experience in marketing. Experience working with HTML, ideally Wordpress and Sitecore platforms. Exposure to paid search campaigns and search engine optimization. Experience with CRM and marketing automation platforms, ideally Dynamics and Oracle applications, including reporting and analytics. task_text:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
 Are you ready to set the pace as an expert problem solver? You will be challenged with ensuring data makes sense and knowing when to dig deeper. You will also be tasked with communicating the results of your work in a meaningful way to broad audiences, including our valuable clients.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
 Extract, analyze, aggregate, and interpret quantitative data Perform quantitative analysis of Actuarial, financial, utilization and costs data Design and run complex data programs Develop and review ad hoc exhibits based on detailed data sets Assist in the development and preparation of quarterly financial forecasts      Develop, conduct, and evaluate studies on pricing, utilization, and health care costs for our broad range of clients Analyze pricing and risk assumptions as part of the evaluation of health care management programs
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
 Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Proficiency working with formulas, calculations, charts, graphs in MS Excel Ability to quickly learn and use computer software tools effectively Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance
Preferred Qualifications:

task_text:
FirstEnergy
FirstEnergy at a Glance
We are a forward-thinking electric utility powered by a diverse team of employees committed to making customers’ lives brighter, the environment better and our communities stronger.
FirstEnergy (NYSE: FE) is dedicated to safety, reliability and operational excellence. Headquartered in Akron, Ohio, FirstEnergy includes one of the nation's largest investor-owned electric systems, more than 24,500 miles of transmission lines that connect the Midwest and Mid-Atlantic regions, and a regulated generating fleet with a total capacity of 3,780 megawatts.
About the Opportunity
This is an open position with FirstEnergy Service Co., a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp.  [SC00] 
The ability to work remotely within the United States may be available based on business need.  This option is not available in the states of California, Colorado, Illinois, Kentucky, New York, Oregon or Washington at this time.
Responsibilities Include:
 Development and support of internal applications using Visual Studio, VS Code, .NET Framework, using Angular & C#. Migrate or develop applications to Microsoft Azure as PaaS, or On-premise private cloud or mobile devices. Building and deploying mobile optimized web applications that are focused on ease-of-use, task-driven functionality, and a consistent user experience across multiple mobile devices and operating systems. Management of source code repositories, builds, and deploys using Microsoft’s Azure DevOps Develop & drive the adoption of standards and governance to ensure FirstEnergy’s Microsoft development platform remains stable, reliable, and secure for all users. Active participation in a collaborative work environment on your team and with other teams throughout the enterprise. Availability to work flexible hours to support our Microsoft application portfolio. Frequent interaction with business owners/stakeholders to gather requirements for new development projects, assist in defect resolution during testing, etc. 
An employee hired at a Level IV, will be expected to perform the above responsibilities with expert-level proficiency and in a more independent manner. 
Qualifications include:
 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer/Management Information Systems, a related degree required with a minimum of 4 years related experience. In lieu of a degree, 6 years related experience required  Related experience includes, but is not limited to: Proficient use of C#, CSS, HTML, OData, REST, Json, Angular, JavaScript and/or jQuery, PowerShell   Minimum of 2+ years development experience leveraging the .NET framework (4.0 or later / .NET Core), C#, and Visual Studio 2017 or later. Experience/Knowledge using Microsoft’s Azure DevOps to manage source code, manage developer tasks and bugs, and perform builds/deploys. Experience developing against SQL Server 2016 or later, Azure SQL DB, Oracle may also be required depending on the project/assignment. Solid working knowledge of MVC 5.0 or later Strong working experience in Angular 8 or greater Solid working knowledge of Entity Framework 6 or later including Code-First Migrations Proven ability to troubleshoot and solve problems in a production support environment; possess analytical skills to effectively resolve technical problems, identify and implement process improvements, and think creatively. Must be skilled in both oral and written communications in order to contribute to meetings and capture requirements as well as write documentation, specifications, procedures and process flows. Willingness to undertake assignments involving unfamiliar subjects and possesses an aptitude to learn quickly. Proven team player, contributes to team goals, encourages and supports team members. Ability and willingness to work flexible hours and be available for call-in and after hours support if needed. 
Qualifications at the Level IV include all the above, plus a Bachelor Degree in a related field and a minimum of 7 years related experience required. In lieu of a degree, 9 years related experience required.
Preferred Qualifications:
 Has worked and been an active participant on a Scrum team or similar Agile methodology.  User interface component development using tools like Telerik’s Kendo UI  Experience developing applications that work with Azure application services / Resource Manager.  Knowledge of rich client frameworks such as Angular Experience utilizing OData web services across .NET applications. Experience with Bootstrap mobile-friendly framework for web development Automated unit testing using MS Test, nUnit, xUnit or similar testing frameworks. Experience with Fakes, Moles, Moq, Rhino Mocks or similar mocking frameworks 
#CB
Benefits, Compensation & Workforce Diversity  At FirstEnergy, employees are key to our success. We depend on their talents to meet the challenges of our changing business environment. We are committed to rewarding individual and team efforts through our total rewards philosophy which includes competitive pay plus incentive compensation, a company-sponsored pension plan, 401(k) savings plan with matching employer contribution, a choice of medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, and life insurance programs, as well as skills development training with tuition reimbursement. Please visit our website at www.firstenergycorp.com to learn more about all of our employee rewards programs. FirstEnergy proudly supports workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with a disability. No recruiters or agencies without a previously signed contract. Unable to sponsor or transfer H-1B visas at this time.  Safety  Safety is a core value for FirstEnergy and is essential to all of our business activities. We ensure employees have the tools, information, and processes to perform their duties in a manner that assures safety for themselves, their co-workers, our customers and the public. Our goals are to provide a safe work environment, to maintain an accident-free, injury-free workplace, and to promote and maintain public safety. To meet these goals, we dedicate ourselves to achieving world-class safety standards.  Position Classification  Exempt 
FirstEnergy Human Resources Team FirstEnergy
FirstEnergy at a Glance
We are a forward-thinking electric utility powered by a diverse team of employees committed to making customers’ lives brighter, the environment better and our communities stronger.
FirstEnergy (NYSE: FE) is dedicated to safety, reliability and operational excellence. Headquartered in Akron, Ohio, FirstEnergy includes one of the nation's largest investor-owned electric systems, more than 24,500 miles of transmission lines that connect the Midwest and Mid-Atlantic regions, and a regulated generating fleet with a total capacity of 3,780 megawatts.
About the Opportunity
This is an open position with FirstEnergy Service Co., a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp.  [SC00] 
The ability to work remotely within the United States may be available based on business need.  This option is not available in the states of California, Colorado, Illinois, Kentucky, New York, Oregon or Washington at this time.

 Development and support of internal applications using Visual Studio, VS Code, .NET Framework, using Angular & C#. Migrate or develop applications to Microsoft Azure as PaaS, or On-premise private cloud or mobile devices. Building and deploying mobile optimized web applications that are focused on ease-of-use, task-driven functionality, and a consistent user experience across multiple mobile devices and operating systems. Management of source code repositories, builds, and deploys using Microsoft’s Azure DevOps Develop & drive the adoption of standards and governance to ensure FirstEnergy’s Microsoft development platform remains stable, reliable, and secure for all users. Active participation in a collaborative work environment on your team and with other teams throughout the enterprise. Availability to work flexible hours to support our Microsoft application portfolio. Frequent interaction with business owners/stakeholders to gather requirements for new development projects, assist in defect resolution during testing, etc. 
An employee hired at a Level IV, will be expected to perform the above responsibilities with expert-level proficiency and in a more independent manner.

task_text:
Job ID:100210  
Job Category:Nursing  
Specialty Area:Pediatrics  
Primary Shift:Night  
Work Schedule:per diem night shift  
Penn Medicine Entity:Chester County Hospital    
 
Location:West Chester, PA  
Address:701 E Marshall St  
Education Required:Per Position Description  
Experience Required:Per Position Description  
Employment Type:Per Diem    
 
 
 
 Penn Medicine is dedicated to our tripartite mission of providing the highest level of care to patients, conducting innovative research, and educating future leaders in the field of medicine. Working for this leading academic medical center means collaboration with top clinical, technical and business professionals across all disciplines.Today at Penn Medicine, someone will make a breakthrough. Someone will heal a heart, deliver hopeful news, and give comfort and reassurance. Our employees shape our future each day. Are you living your life's work?   
 Position Description: General Summary StatementProvides comprehensive, quality nursing care through application of the nursing process.  Adheres to Nursing Policies and Procedures and Organizational Goals and Objectives.  Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesClinical Practice1. Provides age appropriate care for the population served.  Gives consideration to growth & developmental phase of life, to age related factors such as thermal regulation, nutrition, medication administration, nutrition, safety and functional needs of the patient.2. Uses appropriate resources for patients with special needs such as language barriers, sensory problems, altered cognition, cultural and religious needs.3. Ensures attention to patient’s physical, spiritual and emotional well being.4. Demonstrates competency in assessment skills (Includes admission and shift assessments).5. Performs pain assessments and intervenes to optimally meet patient’s needs for comfort.6. Plans clinical care based on patient’s needs and uses available resources.7. Performs clinical care in accordance with policy and procedure.8. Performs peripheral venipuncture and peripheral and central vascular access care according to policy & procedure.9. Evaluates outcomes of nursing interventions and takes appropriate actions to move patient toward reaching goals of care.10. task_text:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message.  In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application. 
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
The Chief Operating Office (COO) is responsible for delivering a more consistent approach to business operations across Wells Fargo, strengthening the company’s risk and control infrastructure, and delivering effective and efficient enterprise services to employees and customers.
The COO group includes the head of Operations, who is jointly responsible for line of business operations with each of the five LOB CEOs. Operations functions include contact center operations, client servicing support, money movements within our businesses, lending operations, and other functions.The COO group also includes a number of teams dedicated to strengthening Wells Fargo’s risk and control infrastructure. These include the Control Executive team; Regulatory and Policy Affairs; Enterprise Customer Excellence; Sales Practices Oversight and Management; and Strategic Execution and Operations.
The Chief Administrative Office, encompassing the Corporate Properties Group; Corporate Security; Enterprise Business Resiliency; Strategic Programs and Process Improvement; Enterprise Change Management; Supply Chain Management; and Data Management and Insights, delivers important services for our employees and customers.
Come join the Shoreview Lockbox Team! Schedule: 40hrs/week. Tuesday-Saturday 7AM - 3:30PM or when work is completed. 
NOTE: Schedule is open-ended and shift ends when all the work is completed. Must be able to work mandatory overtime required as needed. 
Starting pay is $16-$17hr DOE. *Benefits eligible.  As a Data Processing Clerk, your primary responsibility is the data entry of miscellaneous customer information that includes check dollar amounts and invoice data. Team Members must maintain an established productivity standard for amount of keystrokes entered per hour and a high quality standard for volume of transactions before an error occurs. Duties may also include: miscellaneous mailroom support including dispatch, logging, and mail sorting, extracting lockbox payments, verifying data on payments and accompanying documents, or processing according to a customer's detailed instructions. Team Members must understand the workflow, deadlines and requirements for each individual customer. Team Members will train to be able to assist in other departments as needed and perform other duties as assigned. *Candidates will be required to pass a virtual Alpha Numeric Skills assessment.
Want to learn more about our team? Copy and paste this video URL into a new browser tab to hear what our team members are saying: [Link available when viewing the job] />Required Qualifications
6+ months of data entry experience demonstrated through work or military experience
Desired Qualifications
Experience meeting departmental, pre-established, and data entry quotas
Good problem solving skills
Ability to navigate multiple computer systems, applications, and utilize search tools to find information
Ability to follow specific guidelines
Lockbox experience
Strong alpha-numeric data entry skills
Solid problem solving skills
Ability to work effectively under direct supervision and follow specific guidelines
Other Desired Qualifications Able to stand and walk for extended periods of time  
Street AddressMN-Shoreview: 1801 Parkview Dr - Shoreview, MN
Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
Benefits SummaryBenefits

Team Members will train to be able to assist in other departments as needed and perform other duties as assigned. *Candidates will be required to pass a virtual Alpha Numeric Skills assessment.
Want to learn more about our team? Copy and paste this video URL into a new browser tab to hear what our team members are saying: [Link available when viewing the job] />Required Qualifications
6+ months of data entry experience demonstrated through work or military experience
Experience meeting departmental, pre-established, and data entry quotas
Ability to navigate multiple computer systems, applications, and utilize search tools to find information
Ability to work effectively under direct supervision and follow specific guidelines
Other Desired Qualifications Able to stand and walk for extended periods of time  
Street AddressMN-Shoreview: 1801 Parkview Dr - Shoreview, MN
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

task_title: Data Entry & Reporting Clerk, MSAT CAR T
task_text:
Title: Data Entry & Reporting Clerk, MSAT CAR T Location: Summit, NJ Start date: ASAP 
Responsibilities:
  The Data Entry & Reporting Clerk is responsible for supporting the production of personalized cell therapy products for both global clinical trials and commercial supply.  The Data Entry & Reporting Clerk collects critical data from physical paper records and/or electronic sources and captures it for further monitoring, trending and analysis.  Ensure data is captured correctly, in an organized manner that is easy to find and analyze.  May be required to report on collected data and communicate potential areas for improvement leading to a more efficient and compliant data collection and/or analysis practices. Ensure safe and compliant cGMP operations. Support the MSAT team in capture, analysis and trending of critical manufacturing data. Transferring data from paper or electronic formats into spreadsheets or database systems Creating and managing spreadsheets Verifying data by comparing it to source documents/locations Filtering, compiling, and reporting data per management specifications and data analysis needs Assisting with design and continuous improvement of data collection practices and tools. Leadership Support organizational strategic goals and objectives that are linked to the overall company strategy Build trust and effective relationships with peers and stakeholders Deliver business results through timely and quality decision making and advice Foster a culture of compliance and strong environmental, health, and safety performance Promote a mindset of continuous improvement, problem solving, and prevention   
Requirements:
  Bachelor’s Degree required (Science or Engineering is preferred) Previous experience as a data entry clerk or similar position, attention to detail, familiarity with spreadsheets and other MS Office tools. Excellent knowledge of spreadsheets and other MS Office tools Basic knowledge of statistics and statistical tools Great attention to detail Ability to translate verbal requests into data reporting techniques  Possess strong verbal/written communication skills   Joule, a System One division is a leader in specialized workforce solutions and integrated services. With more than 6,000 employees and roughly 50 offices throughout the U.S. we provide scientific, clinical, engineering, energy, IT, legal and administrative staffing services. For more than 40 years, we have delivered workforce solutions and integrated services to clients nationally. Title: Data Entry & Reporting Clerk, MSAT CAR T Location: Summit, NJ Start date: ASAP

Heavy Civil / Bridge Estimator 
 My client is a leading excavating/construction firm in need of an Estimator with a background in heavy civil project work. The right candidate is comfortable reading and interpreting drawings and specifications, soliciting quotes from subcontractors as well as suppliers, scheduling and preparing take-offs for labor, materials and equipment.  
Qualifications:
  5+ years in bridge/heavy highway construction estimating Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or construction management ODOT and/or PennDOT experience preferred High dollar project estimation experience ($5M+) HCSS HeavyBid Estimating System experience preferred  Superior benefits package includes health, dental, vision, life insurance and LTD alongside generous PTO!  This is an excellent opportunity to join a thriving firm! 
Please send resumes to Tom Ennis, Liberty Personnel: [Email available when viewing the job]
 
Thomas Ennis
Liberty Personnel Services, Inc.
[Phone number shown when applying] | Direct Line

task_text:
We have an immediate opening for a self-motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science R&D Team, working remotely. This position requires a curious mind, skills at improving products and processes using the latest advances in machine learning, natural language processing, and data mining. We are looking for someone to join our team to work on groundbreaking R&D projects, to leverage massive structured, unstructured, transactional, and real-time data sets from a variety of sources to power the data science platform at CareerBuilder using the latest tools in machine learning and big data. 
If you are a statistics, machine learning, or data mining whiz (a.k.a. data scientist) who is equally at home discussing insights with business owners, customers, researchers, or developers, and is willing to roll up your sleeves and do the hard work – we want to hear from you!  You will be working with a range of products and solutions in the recruitment domain for both job seekers and employers. You will understand user behavior and identify patterns influencing EOI, predict employee churn, project career progression, automate generating resume and job descriptions, and all the backend structures that power these features. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to present your research in academic and industry conferences on behalf of CareerBuilder. Your work will be observed by C-Level Executives, Senior Leaders, and others looking to discover drivers of performance across CareerBuilder.com’s most important product lines.
 
Essential Responsibilities:
Understand the business goals and initiatives of the project and use the latest machine learning tools to produce fast prototypes to present to the leadership.
Use out-of-the-box methods to acquire data and build sustainable models in an iterative fashion to meet project goals.
Liaise with the Big Data team to design and execute replicable data acquisition and utilization processes. Acquiring, analyzing, cleaning, and structuring data is an essential part of your daily responsibilities.
Keep up with the latest advances in Machine Learning to identify appropriate techniques to analyze the data and apply appropriate tools to build models that satisfy business goals.
Collaborate with Application Development and Business Development teams to provide integration and implementation of the algorithms you have developed in the production environment.
At our Data Science R&D team, in addition to doing active research to produce tangible business goals, we also believe in furthering the state of the art of existing research by actively participating in and publishing our work at top academic and industry conferences.
 
  Job Requirements: 
 
Hands-on experience in applying the latest research in Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence towards business solutions.
Knowledge of Natural Language Processing, Predictive Modeling, Text Mining, Recommender Systems.
Proficient in using deep learning techniques (LSTM, RNN, CNN, Reinforcement Learning, etc.) and building complex networks to solve challenges in text processing.
Expert in the use of libraries like Tensoflow, Keras, Pandas.
Expert in using a scripting language like Python/Scala/R.
Experience in working in cloud computing platforms like AWS and Big Data technologies such as SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Spark.
Strong collaboration skills and an excellent ability to understand and formulate problems and clearly communicate insights because of your extensive technical and business background.

Able to travel occasionally both domestically and internationally We have an immediate opening for a self-motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science R&D Team, working remotely. This position requires a curious mind, skills at improving products and processes using the latest advances in machine learning, natural language processing, and data mining. We are looking for someone to join our team to work on groundbreaking R&D projects, to leverage massive structured, unstructured, transactional, and real-time data sets from a variety of sources to power the data science platform at CareerBuilder using the latest tools in machine learning and big data. 
If you are a statistics, machine learning, or data mining whiz (a.k.a. data scientist) who is equally at home discussing insights with business owners, customers, researchers, or developers, and is willing to roll up your sleeves and do the hard work – we want to hear from you!  You will be working with a range of products and solutions in the recruitment domain for both job seekers and employers. You will understand user behavior and identify patterns influencing EOI, predict employee churn, project career progression, automate generating resume and job descriptions, and all the backend structures that power these features. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to present your research in academic and industry conferences on behalf of CareerBuilder. Your work will be observed by C-Level Executives, Senior Leaders, and others looking to discover drivers of performance across CareerBuilder.com’s most important product lines.
 
Essential Responsibilities:
Understand the business goals and initiatives of the project and use the latest machine learning tools to produce fast prototypes to present to the leadership.
Use out-of-the-box methods to acquire data and build sustainable models in an iterative fashion to meet project goals.
Liaise with the Big Data team to design and execute replicable data acquisition and utilization processes. Acquiring, analyzing, cleaning, and structuring data is an essential part of your daily responsibilities.
Keep up with the latest advances in Machine Learning to identify appropriate techniques to analyze the data and apply appropriate tools to build models that satisfy business goals.
Collaborate with Application Development and Business Development teams to provide integration and implementation of the algorithms you have developed in the production environment.
At our Data Science R&D team, in addition to doing active research to produce tangible business goals, we also believe in furthering the state of the art of existing research by actively participating in and publishing our work at top academic and industry conferences.

At our Data Science R&D team, in addition to doing active research to produce tangible business goals, we also believe in furthering the state of the art of existing research by actively participating in and publishing our work at top academic and industry conferences. Understand the business goals and initiatives of the project and use the latest machine learning tools to produce fast prototypes to present to the leadership. Use out-of-the-box methods to acquire data and build sustainable models in an iterative fashion to meet project goals. Liaise with the Big Data team to design and execute replicable data acquisition and utilization processes. Acquiring, analyzing, cleaning, and structuring data is an essential part of your daily responsibilities. Keep up with the latest advances in Machine Learning to identify appropriate techniques to analyze the data and apply appropriate tools to build models that satisfy business goals. Collaborate with Application Development and Business Development teams to provide integration and implementation of the algorithms you have developed in the production environment. At our Data Science R&D team, in addition to doing active research to produce tangible business goals, we also believe in furthering the state of the art of existing research by actively participating in and publishing our work at top academic and industry conferences. 
Expert in the use of libraries like Tensoflow, Keras, Pandas.
Experience turning ideas into actionable insights. Able to persuade stakeholders and champion effective techniques through product development. We are looking for an eager learner and you should be able to communicate how you have demonstrated success at telling the story hidden within the data.

Able to travel occasionally both domestically and internationally Frequent phone and computer use Creating written communications Able to sit/stand at a desk Able to bend, sit, stand, lift boxes or equipment (between 0-15 lbs) Able to travel occasionally both domestically and internationally
